analyzed: de lus su rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral zhing lus mnyam pa nyid thob pas zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that he is free from all conceptual thoughts of body and has attained the equality of body.

original: sems can lus la sogs shes pa //
analyzed: sems can lus la sogs shes pa //
translated: The knowledge of the bodies of sentient beings,

original: kun rdzob shes par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes par 'dod pa yin //
translated: and so on, is asserted to be conventional knowledge.

original: ji lta zhe na ;
analyzed: ji lta zhe na ;
translated: How so?

original: de sems can gyi lus kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu tshan 'dis bstan to //üîΩshes bya rnam gsum rnam gzhag pas //
analyzed: de sems can gyi lus kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bcu tshan 'dis bstan to // shes bya rnam gsum rnam gzhag pas //
translated: This is indicated by the ten statements beginning with ‚ÄúHe knows the bodies of sentient beings.üîΩIt is divided into ten types

original: de ni rnam pa bcur dbye'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bcur dbye'o //
translated: by positing the three types of objects of knowledge.

original: sems can gyi lus kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems can gyi lus kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the bodies of sentient beings.

original: zhing gi lus dang zhes bya ba sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten dang / @101b las rnam par smin pa'i lus dang zhes bya ba de skye ba'i rgyu'i las kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing gi lus dang zhes bya ba sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten dang / @101b las rnam par smin pa'i lus dang zhes bya ba de skye ba'i rgyu'i las kyis ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The body of the realm means the world of sentient beings and the physical world. The body of evolutionary action means the cause of birth. The body of affliction should be understood in terms of the side of affliction.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyis theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams kyis theg pa gsum rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodies of the disciples, the solitary sages, the bodhisattvas, and the tathƒÅgatas are distinguished by the three vehicles.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs ni tshig bzhis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs ni tshig bzhis bstan to //
translated: The side of purification is indicated by four terms.

original: theg pa gsum po de yang ye shes kyi lus dang zhes bya ba ye shes gang dang / chos kyi lus dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chos gang gis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum po de yang ye shes kyi lus dang zhes bya ba ye shes gang dang / chos kyi lus dang zhes 'byung ba'i phyir chos gang gis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The three vehicles are distinguished by the body of intuition, by the body of truth, and by the body of reality, as stated.

original: nam mkha'i lus kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs so //üîΩsnod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba nas /
analyzed: nam mkha'i lus kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'i phyogs so // snod kyi 'jig rten la dbang ba nas /
translated: The body of space is also known, which indicates the position of neither.

original: ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dbang ba'i bar gyi dbang de dang / de la bya ba sgrub pa'i sbyor ba mtshungs pa nyid yongs su bstan te //
analyzed: ye shes mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la dbang ba'i bar gyi dbang de dang / de la bya ba sgrub pa'i sbyor ba mtshungs pa nyid yongs su bstan te //
translated: The equality of application in the performance of action in regard to that power, from the power over the receptacle world up to the power over the intuition of complete buddhahood, is taught.

original: 'bras bu sgrub pa'i sbyor ba mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu sgrub pa'i sbyor ba mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The equality of application in the performance of action is the same as the equality of application in the performance of the result.

original: sems can gyi lus rnams la las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni las kyi lus nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi lus rnams la las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni las kyi lus nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The specific afflicted actions of sentient beings‚Äô bodies is the body of action.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni rnam par smin pa'i lus zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni rnam par smin pa'i lus zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The specific afflicted birth is the body of evolutionary action.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni nyon mongs pa'i lus nyid ces bya ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni nyon mongs pa'i lus nyid ces bya ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The specific afflicted afflictions is the body of afflictions.

original: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i bye brag ni gzugs kyi lus nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i bye brag ni gzugs kyi lus nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The specific bodies with form and without form is the body of form.

original: chung du nyid ni stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: chung du nyid ni stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bye brag go //
translated: The specific small is the thousandfold world system.

original: rgya chen por gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong gnyis pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rgya chen por gyur pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong gnyis pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The specific great is the double-thousand world system.

original: tshad med pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong gsum gyi bye brag go //
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid ces bya ba ni stong gsum gyi bye brag go //
translated: The specific immeasurable is the triple-world system.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid dang rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bye brag go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa nyid dang rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i bye brag go //
translated: The terms ‚Äúdefiled‚Äù and ‚Äúpurified‚Äù refer to the distinction between defiled and undefiled world-realms.

original: rnam par dbye ba smos pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba smos pa ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù refers to the distinction between specific and general characteristics.

original: brda smos pa ni brda tsam nyid de tha snyad tsam nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brda smos pa ni brda tsam nyid de tha snyad tsam nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúconvention‚Äù refers to mere convention, i.e., mere designation.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zag med pas te /
analyzed: gang zag med pas te /
translated: Because there is no person.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na bzhin du rnam par phye ba yin no //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams la ji ltar mngon @102a * //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang las kyi rnam par smin pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na bzhin du rnam par phye ba yin no // de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnams la ji ltar mngon @102a * //
translated: The Master has also distinguished it in the same way, beginning with ‚Äúthe maturation of karma.‚ÄùüîΩHow does he demonstrate the attainment of perfect enlightenment in the bodies of the TathƒÅgatas?

original: par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston pa ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston pa ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i sku nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He knows the very bodies of perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu smon lam btab nas dga' ldan du skyes pa ni smon lam gyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub tu smon lam btab nas dga' ldan du skyes pa ni smon lam gyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of the vow is the body of the vow to attain enlightenment, which is born in the Tusita heaven.

original: sprul pa gang yin pa ni sprul pa'i sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa gang yin pa ni sprul pa'i sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of emanation is the body of emanation.

original: rang gi sku gdung gi ring bsrel byin gyis brlabs pa gang dag yin pa ni byin gyi rlabs kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sku gdung gi ring bsrel byin gyis brlabs pa gang dag yin pa ni byin gyi rlabs kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of blessing is the body of blessing of the relics of his own body.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sku gang yin pa ni gzugs dang mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po'i rgyan gyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sku gang yin pa ni gzugs dang mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po'i rgyan gyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of evolution is the body of form, marks, and excellent signs.

original: 'od zer gang gis ni 'od kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'od zer gang gis ni 'od kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of light is the body of light by which he illuminates the world.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rnam par grol ba thun mong pa gang yin pa ni nyid kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems rnam par grol ba thun mong pa gang yin pa ni nyid kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of self is the common liberation of mind from the world and beyond the world.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa ni bsod nams kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa ni bsod nams kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The body of merit is the uncommon cause of high rebirth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i khams gang yin pa ni chos kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i khams gang yin pa ni chos kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The undefiled realm of the Tathagatas is called the Dharma Body.

original: chags pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa ni ye shes kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa ni ye shes kyi sku nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The wisdom that is free from attachment is called the Wisdom Body.

original: shes pa'i lus rnams la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i bye brag ni shes pa'i lus rnams kyi shin tu dpyad pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i lus rnams la thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i bye brag ni shes pa'i lus rnams kyi shin tu dpyad pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference between the bodies of knowledge that arise from hearing and reflection is called the thorough analysis of the bodies of knowledge.

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bye brag ni ji lte ba bzhin du nges par rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i bye brag ni ji lte ba bzhin du nges par rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The difference between the bodies of knowledge that arise from meditation is called the definite understanding of reality.

original: 'bras bu dang zhugs pa'i bye brag ni 'bras bu dang sbyor bas bsdus pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang zhugs pa'i bye brag ni 'bras bu dang sbyor bas bsdus pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The difference between the results and the paths is called the inclusion of the results and the paths.

original: 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i bye brag ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bye brag ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dbye ba nyid ces bya ba nas de bzhin du slob pa dang mi slob pa nyid kyang rabüîΩtu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i bye brag ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bye brag ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par dbye ba nyid ces bya ba nas de bzhin du slob pa dang mi slob pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction of mundane and supramundane is the distinction of mundane and supramundane.

original: chos kyi lus rnams la chos nyid gcig pas brjod pa ni chos kyi lus rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //üîΩji skad thos pa bzhin du 'dzin pa ni mi 'khrugs pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi lus rnams la chos nyid gcig pas brjod pa ni chos kyi lus rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba yin no // ji skad thos pa bzhin du 'dzin pa ni mi 'khrugs pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The equality of the Dharma bodies is the equality of the Dharma bodies, because of the statement: ‚ÄúThe equality of the Dharma bodies is due to the sameness of their Dharma body.‚ÄùüîΩThe non-perturbation of the Dharma body is the non-perturbation of the Dharma body, because of the statement: ‚ÄúThe non-perturbation of the Dharma body is due to the non-perturbation of the Dharma body.‚Äù

original: gdul bya rnams kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang mthun pa'i 'du shes dang 'chad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs dang @102b brda kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi dbang po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs dang mthun pa'i 'du shes dang 'chad pa rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs dang @102b brda kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The conventional establishment of the Dharma body is the conventional establishment of the Dharma body, because of the statement: ‚ÄúThe conventional establishment of the Dharma body is due to the establishment of the Dharma body in accordance with the faculties, etc., of the disciples.‚Äù

original: dbang po dang bcas pa dang dbang po med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa dang dbang po med pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa ni sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The definition of sentient and non-sentient things is the definition of those having faculties and those not having faculties.

original: mchog gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa sangs rgyas dang chos dang 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog gi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa sangs rgyas dang chos dang 'phags pa'i dge 'dun rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The definition of the supreme is the definition of the Buddha, Dharma, and noble Sangha.

original: nam mkha'i lus rnams la mtha' yas pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i lus rnams kyi tshad med pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i lus rnams la mtha' yas pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i lus rnams kyi tshad med pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The definition of infinite is the definition of the infinite bodies of space.

original: khyab pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad du song ba nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad du song ba nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The definition of pervasive is the definition of omnipresent.

original: bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni lus med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni lus med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The definition of non-manifest and unobstructed is the definition of incorporeal.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid ni nor pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i mtshan nyid ni nor pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The unconditioned characteristic is called ‚Äúnon-error.‚Äù

original: rang gi 'dus byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni yongs kyi mthar thug ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'dus byas rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ni yongs kyi mthar thug ba'i sa'o //
translated: The distinctive purity of one‚Äôs own conditioned is the ‚Äústage of the ultimate end.‚Äù

original: de gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bshad ma thag pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas dang bral ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de rnam par dag pa'i khyad par te mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa bshad ma thag pa'i 'bras bu 'dus ma byas dang bral ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de rnam par dag pa'i khyad par te mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa'o //
translated: The distinctive purity of both of those is the ‚Äústage of nirvana,‚Äù which is the freedom from the unconditioned result that was just explained, whether mundane or supramundane.

original: khyad par ni mi gnas pa nyid yin pas slob dpon nyid kyis sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par ni mi gnas pa nyid yin pas slob dpon nyid kyis sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The distinctive feature is non-abiding, which is taught by the master himself with the words ‚Äúdue to the power of his previous aspirations‚Äù and so on.

original: sa drug pa la khyad zhugs pa ni brtan pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sa drug pa la khyad zhugs pa ni brtan pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: The distinctive feature of the sixth ground is called the ‚Äúground of stability.‚Äù

original: sa drug pa la byang chub sems dpa' 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa sngon du gyur pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba thob pa gang yin pa de sa bdun pa la 'jug pa'i tshe spong bas
analyzed: sa drug pa la byang chub sems dpa' 'dis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa sngon du gyur pas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon par dga' ba thob pa gang yin pa de sa bdun pa la 'jug pa'i tshe spong bas
translated: On the sixth ground, the bodhisattva has already attained the state of delight in the absence of fabrication, having previously abided in the perfection of wisdom. When he enters the seventh ground, he abandons that.

original: de 'khrugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'khrugs pa yin no //
translated: That is its disturbance.

original: 'di'i mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni de lta ras dgu pa la 'jug pas spangs te 'khrugs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni de lta ras dgu pa la 'jug pas spangs te 'khrugs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The occurrence of signlessness on this ground is not abandoned by entering the ninth ground, and so it is not disturbed.

original: 'on kyang mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba ma spangs pa kho nar sa dgu pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang mtshan ma med pa kun du 'byung ba ma spangs pa kho nar sa dgu pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, the occurrence of signlessness is not abandoned, and so the ninth ground is attained.

original: bdun pa yang 'bad pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdun pa yang 'bad pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The seventh ground is also associated with effort.

original: 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' mngon par bsgrubs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' mngon par bsgrubs pas lhun gyis grub pa'i sa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the ground of the spontaneous accomplishment of the former limit because it is accomplished through former limits.

original: sa 'di la ni sngon mngon par bsgrubs zin pa nyid pas thams cad lhun gyis grub par 'jug go //
analyzed: sa 'di la ni sngon mngon par bsgrubs zin pa nyid pas thams cad lhun gyis grub par 'jug go //
translated: On this ground, everything is entered spontaneously because it has already been accomplished.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i @103a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i @103a * //
translated: The Bodhisattvabhumi

original: khyad par ni de lta bu yin no //üîΩgang zag gis ni byas pa yi //
analyzed: khyad par ni de lta bu yin no // gang zag gis ni byas pa yi //
translated: is the difference.üîΩThe etymology of the stage is

original: nges tshig blo dang ldan pa de //
analyzed: nges tshig blo dang ldan pa de //
translated: explained by the wise as follows:üîΩThe stage is so called because one is

original: don gang gis ni mi g-yo ba'i //
analyzed: don gang gis ni mi g-yo ba'i //
translated: not moved from the objective by any means.

original: sa 'thob bstan pas de bshad do //
analyzed: sa 'thob bstan pas de bshad do //
translated: The etymology of the stage is explained as follows:üîΩIt is called stage because one is not moved from the objective.

original: gcig tu mi g-yo nyid dang ni //üîΩgcig tu nyid las mi g-yo dang // rgyu gnyis dag gis nges pa'i tshig /
analyzed: gcig tu mi g-yo nyid dang ni // gcig tu nyid las mi g-yo dang // rgyu gnyis dag gis nges pa'i tshig /
translated: The objective is not moved from the one,üîΩand the one is not moved from the objective.

original: rnam par gzhag par bshad pa yin //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par bshad pa yin //
translated: The etymology is established by these two causes.

original: mi g-yo ba rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba rnam pa 'di gnyi ga yang sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Both of these two kinds of immovability are causes for the continuity of the Buddha lineage.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rjes su song ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúThe continuity of the Buddha lineage.

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan shin tu snang bar gyur pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan shin tu snang bar gyur pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äù Because it says, ‚ÄúThe light of the Buddha qualities is fully evident.üîΩ‚Äù

original: sgrub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam dang spyod pa'i spyad pa'i rjes su song ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam dang spyod pa'i spyad pa'i rjes su song ba zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Practice is referred to by the passage, ‚Äúhe has the same behavior and conduct as the TathƒÅgata.‚Äù

original: nye ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yul mngon du gyur pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba ni sangs rgyas kyi yul mngon du gyur pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Proximity is referred to by the passage, ‚Äúhe has direct experience of the domain of the Buddha.‚Äù

original: de la gcig tu mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: de la gcig tu mi g-yo ba //
translated: The first is the immovable.

original: rtag tu de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis //üîΩlegs par byin brlabs las shes bya //
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin gshegs rnams kyis // legs par byin brlabs las shes bya //
translated: The TathƒÅgatas alwaysüîΩbless him well.

original: yon tan lnga po'i dbang du byas //
analyzed: yon tan lnga po'i dbang du byas //
translated: This is known from the five qualities.

original: rtag par rgyun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis shin tu byin gyis brlabs pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is always and continuously blessed by the TathƒÅgatas.

original: mchod pa'i yon tan ni brgya byin la sogs pas bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchod pa'i yon tan ni brgya byin la sogs pas bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of worship is that he is served by ≈öakra and so on.

original: kun du bsrung ba'i yon tan ni lag na rdo rje rnams phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du bsrung ba'i yon tan ni lag na rdo rje rnams phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of protection is that VajrapƒÅ·πáis follow behind him.

original: rten gyi yon tan ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten gyi yon tan ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of support is that he is not abandoned by the power of meditative concentration.

original: zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan ni zhing gi lus rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa'i yon tan ni zhing gi lus rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The quality of the completely pure realm is due to the accomplishment of the immeasurable differentiation of the bodies of the realms.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan ni de yang rnam pa lngas rab tu dbye ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i yon tan ni de yang rnam pa lngas rab tu dbye ste /
translated: The quality of bringing beings to maturity is also analyzed into five aspects:

original: bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni lus thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i spyod pa'i stobs gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa ni lus thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i spyod pa'i stobs gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The assumption of a birth according to ones desire is due to the possession of the power of conduct that accomplishes all bodies.

original: dbang bo dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes bar nus pa ni mngon par shes pa chen po'i rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pas so //
analyzed: dbang bo dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal shes bar nus pa ni mngon par shes pa chen po'i rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pas so //
translated: The ability to know the faculties, inclinations, and latent propensities is due to the perfection of the great superknowledges.

original: chos kyi tshul la gzud ba'i phyir chos mtha' yas pa rnams 'dzin nus pa ni ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul la gzud ba'i phyir chos mtha' yas pa rnams 'dzin nus pa ni ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ability to hold limitless teachings in order to lead into the way of the Dharma is due to the mastery of limitless concentrations.

original: len par nus pa ni lung bstan pa chad med pa yang dag par nod pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: len par nus pa ni lung bstan pa chad med pa yang dag par nod pa yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ability to take up is the taking up of the uninterrupted prediction.

original: ston pa'i @103b zhus pa ni 'gro ba ji ltar smin pa bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa'i @103b zhus pa ni 'gro ba ji ltar smin pa bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ston par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching is the teaching of manifest complete enlightenment in accordance with the evolution of beings.

original: de la theg chen la zhugs pas //
analyzed: de la theg chen la zhugs pas //
translated: In that, the one who has entered the Great Vehicle

original: gcig pa nyid las mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid las mi g-yo ba //
translated: does not move from the one,

original: dkyil 'khor don ni mi phyed don //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor don ni mi phyed don //
translated: the meaning of the ma·πá·∏çala is the indivisible meaning,

original: rnam pa dgu yis rab tu bstan //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu yis rab tu bstan //
translated: taught with nine aspects.

original: theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor du zhugs pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who has entered the ma·πá·∏çala of the Great Vehicle.

original: shin tu rnam par dpyad pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dpyad pa'i ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: Possessing the great superknowledges of the wisdom of thorough analysis is the indivisible wisdom.

original: rtag par rgyun du shes rab kyi snang ba'i 'od zer rab tu gtong ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag par rgyun du shes rab kyi snang ba'i 'od zer rab tu gtong ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: Constantly emitting the light rays of the illumination of wisdom is the indivisible explanation.

original: chos kyi dbyings chags pa med pa'i lam du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings chags pa med pa'i lam du zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe path of the realm of phenomena, free of attachment‚Äù is the indivisibility of liberation.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi las rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni zhing yongs su dag pa mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi las rnam par dbye ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni zhing yongs su dag pa mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSkill in the activity of the world‚Äù is the indivisibility of the pure realm.

original: yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la 'jug pa mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi rnam pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po la 'jug pa mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe manifestation of all aspects of qualities‚Äù is the indivisibility of entering the Great Vehicle.

original: rang gi sems bskyed pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems bskyed pa la dbang byed pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa mi phyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPower over one‚Äôs own mind‚Äù is the indivisibility of the superknowledges.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa'i ye shes can zhes bya ba ni dri ba lan 'debs par nus pa mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa'i ye shes can zhes bya ba ni dri ba lan 'debs par nus pa mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wisdom that fully understands the past and the future‚Äù is the indivisibility of being able to answer questions.

original: bdud kyi lam thams cad kyi 'jug pa dang ldog pa shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa mi phyed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdud kyi lam thams cad kyi 'jug pa dang ldog pa shes pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa mi phyed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the engagement and disengagement of all the paths of MƒÅra‚Äù is the indivisibility of sitting at the seat of awakening.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang spyod yul thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang spyod yul thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he enters into all the domains and spheres of activity of the tathagatas

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mi phyed pa'o //
translated: refers to the indivisibility of the enlightenment of the tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing zhes bya ba ni lam ches khyad par du 'phags pa ma nyan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing zhes bya ba ni lam ches khyad par du 'phags pa ma nyan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase he attends upon those tathagatas refers to the fact that he is engaged in a path that is even more exalted than the previous ones.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni bsnyen bkur byed pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase he enters into the differentiation of the world systems indicates the purpose of attending upon those tathagatas.

original: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram zin par byas te /
analyzed: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram zin par byas te /
translated: For example, once gold has been made into an ornament

original: 'dzam bu gling gi bdag po'i mgul lam mgo la btags na rten khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir zil gyis mi non par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang zil gyis mi non par 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'dzam bu gling gi bdag po'i mgul lam mgo la btags na rten khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir zil gyis mi non par 'gyur ba de bzhin du sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyang zil gyis mi non par 'gyur ro
translated: and placed on the neck or head of the king of the Jambu River, it cannot be surpassed because of the excellence of its support. In the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is in this pleasurable state cannot be surpassed.

original: // sa 'di rgyu ni bzhi dag gis //
analyzed: // sa 'di rgyu ni bzhi dag gis //
translated: This pleasurable state is the fourth pleasurable state.

original: rnam par gzhag par 'dod pa ste //üîΩsmra ba @104a * //üîΩpo yi rtsol ba rnams //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par 'dod pa ste // smra ba @104a * // po yi rtsol ba rnams //
translated: And the desire to present them.üîΩüîΩThe efforts of the speakerüîΩ

original: phun tshogs gzhag pa dang po yin //üîΩgnyis pa bshad pa'i dbang byas nas //
analyzed: phun tshogs gzhag pa dang po yin // gnyis pa bshad pa'i dbang byas nas //
translated: The first is the perfection of the speaker‚Äôs effort,

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yin //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yin //
translated: the second is the perfection of knowledge,

original: spyod pa la 'jug gsum pa ste //
analyzed: spyod pa la 'jug gsum pa ste //
translated: the third is the perfection of practice,

original: bzhi pa bshad pa rnams kyi phyir //
analyzed: bzhi pa bshad pa rnams kyi phyir //
translated: and the fourth is the perfection of explanation.

original: brgyad pa la ni ye shes kyi //
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni ye shes kyi //
translated: On the eighth, the bodhisattva perfects

original: las mngon bsgrubs pas zhing sbyang ba //üîΩbsgrubs nas sa ni dgu pa la //
analyzed: las mngon bsgrubs pas zhing sbyang ba // bsgrubs nas sa ni dgu pa la //
translated: the activity of knowledge, and then purifies the land.

original: sems can don bya rnams la sbyong //
analyzed: sems can don bya rnams la sbyong //
translated: On the ninth, he is engaged in the welfare of beings,üîΩand on the tenth, he is engaged in the duties of a master of the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi don ni gzugs med pa rnams la thar bar 'du shes pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni gzugs med pa rnams la thar bar 'du shes pa'i gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The other perfections are for the sake of others, because the formless states are for the sake of disciples who are conscious of liberation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de ltar ye shes tshad med pas rnam par dpyad pa'i blos yang rnam par thar pa zhi ba gong ma rnams shes par byed ces bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ye shes tshad med pas rnam par dpyad pa'i blos yang rnam par thar pa zhi ba gong ma rnams shes par byed ces bya ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúThus, by the mind‚Äôs analysis with immeasurable knowledge, he is conscious of the higher liberations.‚Äù

original: bdag gi don ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mthong ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi don ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes mthong ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The benefit for oneself is from the perspective of the vision of the Buddha's wisdom.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gong ma ma rdzogs pa la rnam par spyod ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes gong ma ma rdzogs pa la rnam par spyod ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it says, he practices in order to complete the higher wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: gcig gis na de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gcig gis na de lta bu yin no //
translated: One verse on the analysis of the benefits for others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ba rjes su 'jug par bya ba 'jug ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa dag gi dbang du byas pa'o //üîΩye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i che ba nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung ba rjes su 'jug par bya ba 'jug ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' yongs su smin pa dag gi dbang du byas pa'o // ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i che ba nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he engages in the Tathagata's speech refers to those bodhisattvas who are mature.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa la sbyor ba'i gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems pa la sbyor ba'i gdul bya rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he discerns the greatness of inconceivable wisdom refers to those disciples who are engaged in improper reflection.

original: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yongs su spyod zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dag chos kyi tshul bstan pas shes par bya ba rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yongs su spyod zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa dag chos kyi tshul bstan pas shes par bya ba rnams kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he engages in the discernment of retention and concentration refers to those disciples who are to be taught the Dharma in order to make them understand.üîΩOne verse on the analysis of the benefits of both.

original: mngon par shes ba rgya chen po mngon bar sgrub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes ba rgya chen po mngon bar sgrub ces bya ba ni /
translated: The line they accomplish the vast superknowledges

original: skyabs ngan par zhugs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: skyabs ngan par zhugs pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: is for those who have entered bad paths.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dad par byas nas /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dad par byas nas /
translated: Having inspired them with the superknowledges,

original: skyabs ngan pa las zlog par byed do //
analyzed: skyabs ngan pa las zlog par byed do //
translated: they turn them away from bad paths.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba shes par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dbye ba shes par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The line they cause the knowledge of the differentiation of world systems to be known

original: mtho ris la mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mtho ris la mos pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: is for those who aspire to the higher realms.

original: zhing kho na la de lta bu'i yongs su dag pa kun du bstan nas mtho ris la mos ba zlog par byed do //
analyzed: zhing kho na la de lta bu'i yongs su dag pa kun du bstan nas mtho ris la mos ba zlog par byed do //
translated: Having revealed to them the purification of a buddhaverse, they turn them away from the aspiration for the higher realms.

original: lnga pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the fifth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos mi 'phrogs pa yongs su sbyor bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos mi 'phrogs pa yongs su sbyor bar byed ces bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: The line they cause the unshared qualities of the Buddha such as the powers to be perfected is about manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i @104b chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khyu mchog tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'jug ces bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i @104b chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba khyu mchog tu gyur pa'i rjes su 'jug ces bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe follows the supreme ones who turn the wheel of the Dharma of the Tathagatas‚Äù means that he turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs 'thob pa mi 'dor zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs 'thob pa mi 'dor zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not abandon the attainment of the consecration of great compassion‚Äù means that he manifests complete nirvana.

original: sems can la lta ba dang bcas pas snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs 'thob pa dang ; mi 'dor bar gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kun du ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can la lta ba dang bcas pas snying rje chen po'i byin gyi rlabs 'thob pa dang ; mi 'dor bar gnyis kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa kun du ston par byed do //
translated: With the two, he manifests complete nirvana, because he has great compassion, which is directed toward sentient beings, and he does not abandon the attainment of the consecration of great compassion.

original: gsum gyis ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: With the three, he is like that.

original: ye shes shes bya rnam byang stsogs //
analyzed: ye shes shes bya rnam byang stsogs //
translated: Knowledge, objects of knowledge, purification, etc.

original: gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis //üîΩrnam pa bcur ni rab bstan nas //
analyzed: gong ma gong ma'i khyad par gyis // rnam pa bcur ni rab bstan nas //
translated: The highest of the highest distinctionsüîΩare taught as ten kinds.

original: bshad pa yin par rnam shes bya //
analyzed: bshad pa yin par rnam shes bya //
translated: They should be understood as explained.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos rnams rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa'i chos rnams rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yin no // zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: He knows well the wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral dharmas that are being actualized. This means that he knows well the dharmas that are purified, defiled, and neither of those two.üîΩHe knows well the dharmas that are being actualized as having outflows or without outflows. This means that he knows well that those purified dharmas are both with outflows and without outflows.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon par 'du byed pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa rnams kyang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag tu rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos mngon par 'du byed pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa rnams kyang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dag tu rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows well the dharmas that are being actualized as mundane or supramundane. This means that he knows well that the without-outflows are both mundane and supramundane.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba de de rnams kyang bsam du yod pa dang bsam gyis mi lang ba dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //üîΩnges pa dang ma nges pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni bsam du yod pa rnams kyang nges pa dang ma nges pa dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba de de rnams kyang bsam du yod pa dang bsam gyis mi lang ba dag tu rab tu shes pa'o // nges pa dang ma nges pa'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba zhes bya ba ni bsam du yod pa rnams kyang nges pa dang ma nges pa dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: The inconceivable and the phenomena of the inconceivable are fully known as the conceivable and the inconceivable.üîΩThe phenomena of the definite and the indefinite are fully known as the definite and the indefinite.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa de rnams kyang theg pa gsum po dag la rab tu shes te /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa de rnams kyang theg pa gsum po dag la rab tu shes te /
translated: Those definite and indefinite phenomena are fully known in the three vehicles.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: As it is said in the sutra,üîΩThe phenomena of the conditioned and the unconditioned are fully known.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum pa'i chos de dag kyang lam dang gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos mngon par 'du bya ba yang zhes bya ba ni theg pa gsum pa'i chos de dag kyang lam dang gnas gyur pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir /
translated: Those phenomena of the three vehicles are fully known through the path and the transformation.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba dag tu rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: They are well known as being distinguished by the conditioned and the unconditioned.üîΩ

original: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyu ba thibs po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes bya ba @105a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi sems kyi rgyu ba thibs po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes bya ba @105a * //
translated: He knows the various kinds of mental orientation of beings, as they are in reality.

original: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten sems bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyon mongs pa dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten sems bstan to //
translated: This shows the basis of the addictions and actions, which is the mind.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ba thibs po zhes bya ba ni sems la brten pa nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ba thibs po zhes bya ba ni sems la brten pa nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe thickets of the addictions‚Äù shows the addiction of the addictions, which is based on the mind.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe thickets of action‚Äù shows the addiction of action, which is based on the mind.

original: las kyi rgyu ba thibs po zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems la brten pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu ba thibs po zhes bya ba 'dis ni sems la brten pa las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa bstan to //
translated: The verse shows the three kinds of addictions:üîΩThe addictions of birth,

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs las //üîΩbrtsams te dbang sogs rim pa yis //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs rnam byang bar //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs las // brtsams te dbang sogs rim pa yis // kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang bar //
translated: The addictions of the life-cycle,üîΩAnd the addictions of the obscurations.üîΩThe verse shows the three kinds of addictions: the addictions of birth, the addictions of the life-cycle, and the addictions of the obscurations.üîΩThe addictions of birth are the addictions of the ground of nescient latent afflictions.üîΩThe addictions of the life-cycle are the addictions of the six active consciousnesses.

original: des dang ma des gnas skabs yin //
analyzed: des dang ma des gnas skabs yin //
translated: The addictions of the obscurations are the addictions of the afflicted view of the self.

original: mos pa la sogs pa ni dbang po la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rgyu'i thibs po dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: mos pa la sogs pa ni dbang po la sogs pa dang mthun pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rgyu'i thibs po dang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Because of being in accord with the faculties, etc., means that the faculties, etc., are the cause of the thickets, etc.

original: phung po gsum du rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu ba thibs po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩchung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam pas dbang po dag ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba /
analyzed: phung po gsum du rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu ba thibs po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro // chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam pas dbang po dag ci 'dra bar 'gyur ba /
translated: Because of the statement: ‚ÄúOne understands as they really are the thickets of the cause of the faculties, up to the thickets of the cause of the three aggregates.‚ÄùüîΩThe faculties are of three types: weak, middling, and strong.

original: mos pa rnams kyang de kho na 'dra bar 'gyur te /üîΩkhams la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: mos pa rnams kyang de kho na 'dra bar 'gyur te / khams la sogs pa nas /
translated: The inclinations are also of three types: weak, middling, and strong.üîΩThe elements, etc., are also of three types: weak, middling, and strong.

original: phung po gsum du rnam par gnas pa la thug pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar brjod do //
analyzed: phung po gsum du rnam par gnas pa la thug pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar brjod do //
translated: The thickets, etc., are also of three types: weak, middling, and strong.

original: mang po gang yin pa de ni thibs po yin no //
analyzed: mang po gang yin pa de ni thibs po yin no //
translated: The thickets are the many.

original: shes par mi nus pa'i don ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par mi nus pa'i don ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúincapable of being known‚Äù is that they are difficult to fathom.

original: sems can rgyu ba thibs po zhes bya ba ni de sems can rnams kyi sems rnam pa tha dad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rgyu ba thibs po zhes bya ba ni de sems can rnams kyi sems rnam pa tha dad pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ‚Äúthicket of sentient beings‚Äù is the various kinds of minds of sentient beings, which he knows as they truly are.

original: sems rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems rnam pa sna tshogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The ‚Äúvariety of minds‚Äù is the characteristic of differentiation.

original: sems skad cig gcig tu 'gyur ba dang 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems skad cig gcig tu 'gyur ba dang 'jig pa dang mi 'jig pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The ‚Äúmomentary arising and perishing of the mind and its non-perishing‚Äù is the characteristic of change.

original: sems lus med pa nyid ces don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems lus med pa nyid ces don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The ‚Äúmindlessness of the mind‚Äù is the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: sems mtha' yas shing thams cad du mang ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems mtha' yas shing thams cad du mang ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The ‚Äúboundlessness and omnipresence of the mind‚Äù is the characteristic of its intrinsic nature.

original: sems 'od gsal ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems 'od gsal ba nyid ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The ‚Äúluminosity of the mind‚Äù is the characteristic of its intrinsic nature as uncontaminated.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pa dang kun nas dkris pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis @105b so ;
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa dang bcas pa dang kun nas dkris pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis @105b so ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is associated with affliction and free from affliction‚Äù refers to the characteristic of being associated with and free from the entanglements.

original: / sems bcings pa dang rnam par thar pa nyid ces bya ba ni bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang / bag la nyal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
analyzed: / sems bcings pa dang rnam par thar pa nyid ces bya ba ni bag la nyal dang bcas pa dang / bag la nyal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is bound and liberated‚Äù refers to the characteristic of being associated with and free from the latent forms of the afflictions.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba ni sems sgyu ma lta bur rnam par bsgrub pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid kyis ni ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du skye ba ni sems sgyu ma lta bur rnam par bsgrub pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is created and uncreated‚Äù refers to the characteristic of being a cause, because it is said that ‚Äúthe bodhisattva creates the mind that is like an illusion in order to be reborn at will.‚Äù

original: de ma yin pa'i sems can rnams rang gi las dag gis skye ba ni sems 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sems can rnams rang gi las dag gis skye ba ni sems 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind is present in accordance with the destiny of beings‚Äù refers to the mind of other sentient beings that is created by their own karma.

original: ring du song ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ring du song ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe mind has gone far‚Äù refers to the mind of the bodhisattva who has attained the stage of Gone Afar.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the afflictions are related to the peak of existence.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ring du song ba nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ring du song ba nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúThe afflictions are far-reaching.‚Äù

original: shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba mtha' yas pa tshad mi rtogs pa rnams mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa la sbyor ba mtha' yas pa tshad mi rtogs pa rnams mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúDifficult to know‚Äù means that the afflictions are difficult to know because they are the basis of the infinite, immeasurable, and imperceptible applications to virtue and so on.

original: sbyor ba mtha' yas pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba mtha' yas pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúThe afflictions are of infinite application.‚ÄùüîΩHow do the afflictions, birth, and karma afflict?

original: nyon mongs pa dang skye ba dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa nyon mongs par byed pa ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig gi grogs su gcig gyur pas gcig gis gcig bskyed pa ni lhan cig skyes shing mi 'bral ba nyid ces 'byungüîΩba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang skye ba dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kyi sa nyon mongs par byed pa ji ltar zhes bya ba ni gcig gi grogs su gcig gyur pas gcig gis gcig bskyed pa ni lhan cig skyes shing mi 'bral ba nyid ces 'byungüîΩba'i phyir te /
translated: They afflict by being mutually concomitant, mutually generating, and mutually inseparable.

original: nyon mongs pa dang skye ba dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams gcig gi grogs su gcig gyur par 'jug pa na phan tshun skyed par byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang skye ba dang las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams gcig gi grogs su gcig gyur par 'jug pa na phan tshun skyed par byed pa dag yin no //
translated: helpers, they are mutually productive.

original: de yod na zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal yod na'o //
analyzed: de yod na zhes bya ba ni bag la nyal yod na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it exists‚Äù means if the latent state exists.üîΩ‚ÄúBecause one is not liberated from it‚Äù means because one is not liberated

original: de las mi 'grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa las mi 'grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de las mi 'grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa las mi 'grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: from the envelopment.üîΩThis is the same as the statement that latent states and envelopments are

original: bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa don gcig pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal dang kun nas dkris pa don gcig pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: equivalent.

original: gang bcings pa zhes bya ba ni sems te sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang bcings pa zhes bya ba ni sems te sems mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is bound‚Äù is the mind, because it is said that the mind is associated and not associated with the afflictions.

original: gal te sems de bar skabs su nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma bcings na thar pa'i skabs yod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te sems de bar skabs su nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma bcings na thar pa'i skabs yod kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa smos so //
translated: If the mind is not bound by the defilements in the interval, there is an occasion for liberation, but not otherwise.

original: lus kyi 'gro bas ni skye ba'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gro bas ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩkhams kyi dbye ba ni khams gsum pa rnam @106a * //
analyzed: lus kyi 'gro bas ni skye ba'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gro bas ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro // khams kyi dbye ba ni khams gsum pa rnam @106a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the going of the body‚Äù means that the mind is present in the place where the body is born.

original: par phye ba nyid ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: par phye ba nyid ces bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe division of the realms‚Äù means the division of the three realms.

original: sred pa dang ma rig pa dang lta ba'i zug rdu kha na ma tho ba chen po nyid ces bya ba ni rgyus te skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: sred pa dang ma rig pa dang lta ba'i zug rdu kha na ma tho ba chen po nyid ces bya ba ni rgyus te skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe great fault of craving, ignorance, and views‚Äù means the defilement of birth, which is taught by the cause.

original: las rnam pa gsum gyi gzhi rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la phyogs gsum po 'dod pas longs spyod pa'i phyogs de'i gzhi ni srid pa ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las rnam pa gsum gyi gzhi rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la phyogs gsum po 'dod pas longs spyod pa'i phyogs de'i gzhi ni srid pa ste rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ‚Äúcontinual ground of the three kinds of action‚Äù means that the ground of the three kinds of action is the cause of the three kinds of action.

original: sdom pa med pa'i phyogs de'i gzhi ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa med pa'i phyogs de'i gzhi ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The ground of the side of the absence of vows is ignorance.

original: mu stegs can gyi phyogs de'i gzhi ni lta ba dang nga rgyal te gzhi 'di rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi phyogs de'i gzhi ni lta ba dang nga rgyal te gzhi 'di rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ground of the side of the tƒ´rthikas is view and pride.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the action that obstructs liberation in the three sides, and as the cause of the immeasurable actions of body, speech, and mind that accord with sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩThe defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth in sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.

original: phyogs gsum po dag la thar pa'i bar du gcod ba'i las kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las 'khor ba dang mthun pa tshad med pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par
analyzed: phyogs gsum po dag la thar pa'i bar du gcod ba'i las kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las 'khor ba dang mthun pa tshad med pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par
translated: The defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.

original: byed pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: byed pa nyid du yongs su bstan to //
translated: The defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid rab tu dbye bas ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid rab tu dbye bas ni /
translated: The defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.üîΩThe defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.üîΩThe defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.üîΩThe defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.üîΩThe defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the various kinds of birth.üîΩThe defilement by affliction is taught as the cause of the various kinds of afflictions.üîΩThe defilement by action is taught as the cause of the various kinds of action.üîΩThe defilement by birth is taught as the cause of the

original: de las de dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las de dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes te zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: and from that, one also correctly knows virtue, nonvirtue, and what is neutral.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Because virtue and nonvirtue are the causes of happy and miserable rebirths, they are the causes of migration.

original: bsams pa ni lus ngag gi las dag ste /
analyzed: bsams pa ni lus ngag gi las dag ste /
translated: Intentional action is the karma of body and speech,

original: de gnyis kyis sems pa rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis sems pa rnam par rig par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the instigator of the mind.

original: sems pa ni yid kyi las so //
analyzed: sems pa ni yid kyi las so //
translated: Mental karma is the karma of mind.

original: de yang rnam par rig byed bzhin du rnam par rig par mi byed pas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rig byed bzhin du rnam par rig par mi byed pas na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is nonindicative because it does not indicate like indicative form.

original: rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the nonindicative form that is said to be indicative and nonindicative.

original: sems dang sems pa lhan cig skyes nas sems nyid bgos te sems dang tha mi dang par gyur pa'i 'bras bu mngon du 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: sems dang sems pa lhan cig skyes nas sems nyid bgos te sems dang tha mi dang par gyur pa'i 'bras bu mngon du 'grub par byed do //
translated: The mind and mental factors arise simultaneously with intention and the mind itself is divided into two: the mind that is the instigator and the mind that is the result.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di skad du sems dang lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di skad du sems dang lhan cig skyes shing tha mi dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For this very reason, it is said that it is ‚Äúsimultaneously born with the mind and not separate from it.‚Äù

original: rang gi dang gis rgyu med par skad cig la skyes ma thag tu 'jig cing rnam par 'jig cing 'phel ba dang mngon par 'phel bar 'byung ba dang / mngon par 'dus byas pas 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba'i las te /
analyzed: rang gi dang gis rgyu med par skad cig la skyes ma thag tu 'jig cing rnam par 'jig cing 'phel ba dang mngon par 'phel bar 'byung ba dang / mngon par 'dus byas pas 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba'i las te /
translated: It is a cause that is naturally spontaneous, arising in a moment, disintegrating immediately upon arising, and increasing and expanding without being produced, and it is an action that is accomplished through effort and is produced by being brought together.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rgyus rgyu'i dngos pos so //
analyzed: rgyus rgyu'i dngos pos so //
translated: By the nature of the cause being the cause.

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa dang 'phel ba'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa dang mi stsogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa dang 'phel ba'i phyir 'bras bu la sogs pa dang mi stsogs pa'i rab tu dbye ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is the distinction of having a result, etc., and not having a result, etc., because of disintegration and increase.

original: rgyu rang gi dang gis skad cig @106b tu 'jig cing 'phel ba 'bras bu chud mi za zhing mtshams sbyor ba nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rang gi dang gis skad cig @106b tu 'jig cing 'phel ba 'bras bu chud mi za zhing mtshams sbyor ba nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause naturally disintegrates in a moment and increases without being produced, the result is not wasted and is connected.

original: tshul 'di nyid kyis 'bras bu chud mi za bar 'byin par yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid kyis 'bras bu chud mi za bar 'byin par yang shes par bya'o //
translated: This very method should be understood as the production of the result without being wasted.

original: lan grangs gzhan dang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan dang skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is that it is experienced after being reborn in another life.

original: 'bras bu ma smin pa dang smin zin pas rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma smin pa dang smin zin pas rab tu dbye ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa nyid ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The classification of karma in terms of whether or not its result has matured is karma that has a result and karma that does not have a result.

original: ma smin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i phyir la smin zin pa ni rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa'i phyir la smin zin pa ni rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Karma that has not matured is karma that has a result and karma that has matured is karma that does not have a result.üîΩThe classification of karma in terms of whether or not it is an antidote is karma that is neither, karma that is black and white, and karma that is neither black nor white.

original: ming mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba ni gnyi ga ma yin pa nag po yang ma yin dkar po yang ma yin pa dang gnyi ga'i cha 'dren pa'i las yang dag par len pa rab tu dbye ba ste nag po zhes bya ba la
analyzed: ming mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i rab tu dbye ba ni gnyi ga ma yin pa nag po yang ma yin dkar po yang ma yin pa dang gnyi ga'i cha 'dren pa'i las yang dag par len pa rab tu dbye ba ste nag po zhes bya ba la
translated: The classification of karma in terms of the action of attracting a mixed portion of both is karma that is black and so on.

original: sogs pa'i tshig gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i tshig gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The term black and so on refers to the three terms that are stated in the sutra.

original: las nag po dang dkar po dag ni phyogs du ma las rab tu rnam par phye zin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las nag po dang dkar po dag ni phyogs du ma las rab tu rnam par phye zin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Black and white karma are classified in many ways.

original: de gnyi ga yang dag par len pas so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang dag par len pas so //
translated: because both of them are taken up in the right way.

original: mdo'i don ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: mdo'i don ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni bral ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is as follows: ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù means ‚Äúseparate‚Äù;

original: sna tshogs ni 'dren ma nyid de /
analyzed: sna tshogs ni 'dren ma nyid de /
translated: ‚Äúvarious‚Äù means ‚Äúmixed up‚Äù;

original: de gnyis kho na dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kho na dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äújust those two‚Äù means ‚Äújust those two, i.e., the various and the different.‚Äù

original: rkyen rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: rkyen rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The classification of conditions is as follows:

original: las kyi zhing bdag po'i rkyen kho na nyid kyang yin la rgyu'i rkyen nyid kyang yin par shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: las kyi zhing bdag po'i rkyen kho na nyid kyang yin la rgyu'i rkyen nyid kyang yin par shes par bya ba ste /
translated: The field of karma is both the dominant condition and the causal condition.

original: las kyi zhing tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi zhing tshad med pa nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúThe field of karma is immeasurable.‚Äù

original: khor zug tu ma yin pa ni res 'ga' ba'o //
analyzed: khor zug tu ma yin pa ni res 'ga' ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot constant‚Äù means ‚Äúsometimes‚Äù;

original: khor zug ni gnyug ma'o //
analyzed: khor zug ni gnyug ma'o //
translated: ‚Äúconstant‚Äù means ‚Äúhabitual.‚Äù

original: de gnyis rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyis rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: This is the classification of those two.

original: 'phags pa dang 'jig rten par rab tu rnam par phye ba nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dang 'jig rten par rab tu rnam par phye ba nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúThe classification of the holy and the worldly is clearly distinguished.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs gsum ni tshe 'di dang skyes pa dang lan grangs gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum ni tshe 'di dang skyes pa dang lan grangs gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The three states are this life, birth, and other lives.

original: der nges pa dang ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: der nges pa dang ma nges pa ste /
translated: They are certain or uncertain.

original: tshe 'di dang skyes pa dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang skyes pa dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba nyid ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and ‚Äúto be experienced in this life, in the next birth, or in other lives.‚Äù

original: theg pa rnam pa gsum la nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid ni theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa rnam pa gsum la nges pa dang ma nges pa nyid ni theg pa dang theg pa ma yin pa la nges pa dang ma nges pa zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDetermination and non-determination in the three vehicles‚Äù refers to ‚Äúdetermination and non-determination in the vehicle and the non-vehicle.‚Äù

original: theg pa ma yin par nges pa ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams so //
analyzed: theg pa ma yin par nges pa ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams so //
translated: Those who are determined in the non-vehicle are those who will not attain nirvana.üîΩThus, the dense growth of the activity of karma is revealed by the analysis of determination and non-determination.üîΩKarma is determined in terms of its result,üîΩits time, and its place.üîΩKarma is determined in terms of its result, its time, and its place.

original: de ltar na nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye bas las rnams kyi rgyu ba thibs po yang dag par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na nges pa dang ma nges pa rab tu dbye bas las rnams kyi rgyu ba thibs po yang dag par bstan pa yin te /
translated: Karma is determined in terms of its result, its time, and its place.
