original: shes par dka' ba'i phyir de nyid thibs po yin no //
analyzed: shes par dka' ba'i phyir de nyid thibs po yin no //
translated: It is an element because it is difficult to know.

original: de'i nye bar dpyod pa ni rnam par 'byed pa ste /üîΩbye brag tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nye bar dpyod pa ni rnam par 'byed pa ste / bye brag tu shes pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the analysis of that element.

original: de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the understanding of the distinctions.üîΩEndowed with that means endowed with the discernment of the element.

original: de'i phyir rigs khong du chud ba'i phyir de dang 'cham pa'i chos bstan pas thob par rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs khong du chud ba'i phyir de dang 'cham pa'i chos bstan pas thob par rung ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because of the knowledge of the spiritual gene, one is fit to obtain the teaching that is in accord with it.

original: tshig gzung bar 'os pa nyid ces bya ba ni skye bar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags ji lta ba bzhin rjes su 'jug ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gzung bar 'os pa nyid ces bya ba ni skye bar nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags ji lta ba bzhin rjes su 'jug ces gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase his words are worth taking to heart refers to the fact that he is in accord with the propensities of the passions and actions of those who are to be trained.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: skye ba de dang der nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags dang mthun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba de dang der nyon mongs pa dang las kyi bag chags dang mthun par byed pa ste /
translated: He acts in accord with the propensities of the passions and actions of those who are to be trained in such and such a rebirth.

original: mthun pa nyid du sgrub pas ni tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa nyid du sgrub pas ni tshig gzung bar 'os par 'gyur ro //
translated: By his attainment of such accord, his words are worth taking to heart.

original: de lta ma yin na mi shes pa'i ngo bo chos ston par byed pa 'di su zhig ces zer te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi shes pa'i ngo bo chos ston par byed pa 'di su zhig ces zer te /
translated: Otherwise, who would believe the teaching of the Dharma by one whose nature is ignorance?

original: de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not so.

original: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang po rnam par bzlog pa ni tshogs ji lta bu la gnas pa khong du chud par bya ba zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa dang ma nges pa'i dbang po rnam par bzlog pa ni tshogs ji lta bu la gnas pa khong du chud par bya ba zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase he has eliminated the faculties of certainty and uncertainty refers to the fact that he has understood the way to stand in the assembly.

original: log pa nyid kyi tshogs la nges pa'i dbang po rnam par bzlog pa ni dper na bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis ma skyes dgra'i 'gyod pa bsal nas /
analyzed: log pa nyid kyi tshogs la nges pa'i dbang po rnam par bzlog pa ni dper na bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis ma skyes dgra'i 'gyod pa bsal nas /
translated: The reversal of the faculties of those who are definitely in error is like the Bhagavat Manjusri's dispelling of Ajatashatru's remorse.

original: las bsrabs pas ngan song rnams las rnam par bzlog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: las bsrabs pas ngan song rnams las rnam par bzlog pa lta bu'o //
translated: By reducing his evil karma, he was turned away from the miserable states of existence.

original: ma nges pa rnam par bzlog pa ni yang dag pa nyid la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa rnam par bzlog pa ni yang dag pa nyid la 'god pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reversal of those who are indefinite is for the sake of establishing them in reality.

original: theg pa ji lta bus nges par 'byin pa'i snod nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa ji lta bu la mos pas rnam par grol ba thob par byas pas chos ston to zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa ji lta bus nges par 'byin pa'i snod nyid ces bya ba ni theg pa ji lta bu la mos pas rnam par grol ba thob par byas pas chos ston to zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The statement, One teaches the Dharma by means of the vehicle by which one is liberated, refers to the vehicle in which one has faith.

original: rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod pa //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shus gtam brjod pa //
translated: The twenty aspects of discourse

original: ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na //
translated: What are they?

original: dus dang gus par byed pa dang // go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / mthun par ldan pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / tshim par byed pa dang / brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dus dang gus par byed pa dang // go rims dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / mthun par ldan pa dang / dga' bar byed pa dang / mos par byed pa dang / tshim par byed pa dang / brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang /
translated: 1. Time, 2. respect, 3. order, 4. connection, 5. concordance, 6. delight, 7. faith, 8. satisfaction, 9. not being lazy,

original: @110b g-yel bar mi byed pa dang / rigs pa dang / mthun pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: @110b g-yel bar mi byed pa dang / rigs pa dang / mthun pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / chos dang ldan pa dang / 'khor ji lta ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang /
translated: 10. not being negligent, 11. being reasonable, 12. being in accord, 13. being unmixed, 14. being in accord with the Dharma, 15. being in accord with the assembly, 16. having a mind of love, 17. having a mind of benefit,

original: snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams la mi gnas pa dang / bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa'o //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa rnams la mi gnas pa dang / bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan la mi smod pa'o //
translated: 18. having a mind of compassion, 19. not dwelling on gain, honor, and praise, and 20. not praising oneself and disparaging others.

original: de la dus ni mi khom pa brgyad dang ma 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la dus ni mi khom pa brgyad dang ma 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Here, time is not being connected with the eight inopportune situations.

original: dper na / mya ngan gyis gdungs rims btab 'khrugs pa yul la mngon phyogs rnam par nyams par gnas //
analyzed: dper na / mya ngan gyis gdungs rims btab 'khrugs pa yul la mngon phyogs rnam par nyams par gnas //
translated: one who is afflicted by grief, who is sick, who is agitated, who is absorbed in an object, who is impaired,

original: sgo ba med cing srung ma med dang phrad ma zhugs dang sgrub pa med pa yi //
analyzed: sgo ba med cing srung ma med dang phrad ma zhugs dang sgrub pa med pa yi //
translated: who is without a door, who is without a protector, who has not entered, who is not established,

original: rgyal po la ni yul dus shes pa ji ltar rang don brjod par mi 'dod ltar //
analyzed: rgyal po la ni yul dus shes pa ji ltar rang don brjod par mi 'dod ltar //
translated: just as a king who knows the country and the time does not want to speak his own purpose,

original: sems kyi rgyal po mi khom brgyad dang 'brel pa yi ni tshul ni de nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyal po mi khom brgyad dang 'brel pa yi ni tshul ni de nyid do //
translated: in the same way, the king of minds, which is connected with the eight inopportune states, has that very nature.

original: bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: as explained.

original: gus par byed ces bya ba ni mthun pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gus par byed ces bya ba ni mthun pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: One should be respectful means one should stand in a compatible posture,

original: mi mthun pas gnas pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pas gnas pa la ma yin te /
translated: not in an incompatible one.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: min par 'dug pa la 'greng ste chos mi bshad par bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: min par 'dug pa la 'greng ste chos mi bshad par bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One should train that one should not explain the Dharma while standing to one who is sitting, and so on.

original: gong mis zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gong mis zhes bya ba ni tshig dang yi ge go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'o //
translated: The above means teaching in the order of words and syllables.

original: mtshams sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin kho nar don gyi sgo nas kyang rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin kho nar don gyi sgo nas kyang rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase he analyzes means that he also analyzes the meaning in a manner that accords with the order.

original: mthun par ldan zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan par chos ston gyi don dang mi ldan par ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par ldan zhes bya ba ni don dang ldan par chos ston gyi don dang mi ldan par ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase he teaches in a manner that is consistent with the meaning means that he teaches the Dharma in a manner that is consistent with the meaning, not in a manner that is inconsistent with the meaning.

original: dga' bar byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par bstan par bya ba rnams la yang dag par ston pa'o //üîΩmos par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bar byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par bstan par bya ba rnams la yang dag par ston pa'o // mos par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya ba rnams la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase he delights means that he delights those who are to be taught by means of the correct teaching.üîΩThe phrase he causes them to be devoted means that he causes those who are to be caused to take up to take up the correct teaching.

original: tshim par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya ba rnams la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'o //
analyzed: tshim par byed ces bya ba ni yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya ba rnams la yang dag par gzengs bstod pa'o //
translated: The phrase he satisfies means that he satisfies those who are to be caused to take up by means of the correct teaching.

original: brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang g-yel bar mi byed ces bya ba rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni yang dag par dga' bar bya ba rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brtun ngas par mi byed pa dang g-yel bar mi byed ces bya ba rnam pa 'di gnyis kyis ni yang dag par dga' bar bya ba rnams yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase he does not become lazy or indifferent indicates that he delights those who are to be caused to take up.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i gtam zer ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma dang ldan pa'i gtam zer ba'o //
translated: Reasoned means that the talk is endowed with the three means of valid knowledge: direct perception, inference, and authoritative testimony.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni bde 'gror 'gro ba dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Agreeable means that it is in accord with going to good rebirths.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'khrugs pa gzing gzing ba ma @111a * //üîΩyin pa'o // chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'khrugs pa gzing gzing ba ma @111a * // yin pa'o // chos dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Unmixed means that it is not confused, not muddled.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o //üîΩ'khor ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan pa'o // 'khor ji lta ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Endowed with the Dharma means that it is endowed with the Four Noble Truths.

original: 'khor bzhi'am brgyad de /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi'am brgyad de /
translated: In accordance with the assembly means that it is in accordance with the four or eight assemblies.

original: gang la ji ltar gtam gang 'os pa de la de ltar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang la ji ltar gtam gang 'os pa de la de ltar brjod pa'o //
translated: Whatever talk is appropriate for a given assembly, that is what is spoken to that assembly.

original: re zhig rnam pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i gtam du shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa bco lnga po 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i gtam du shes bar bya'o //
translated: These fifteen aspects should be understood as the bodhisattva's talk for the benefit of others, endowed with all aspects.

original: de'i 'og tu byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: With a mind of loving-kindness means towards sentient beings who are harmful.

original: phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyad pa spyod pa'i sems can rnams la'o //
translated: The phrase with a mind of benefit refers to sentient beings who engage in misconduct.

original: snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis rgyags pa dang / sro shi ba rnams la'o //üîΩmi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa thams cad la re ba med pa zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyis rgyags pa dang / sro shi ba rnams la'o // mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa thams cad la re ba med pa zang zing med pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: The phrase with a mind of compassion refers to those who are intoxicated with pleasure and those who are despondent with pain.üîΩThe phrase without a home means that he or she teaches Dharma to sentient beings with a mind that is free of material desires and that is not seeking any gain, honor, or fame.

original: bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan mi smod ces bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi phrag dog gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar sems can rnams la chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la mi bstod cing gzhan mi smod ces bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi phrag dog gis kun nas dkris pa dang bral bar sems can rnams la chos ston pa ste /
translated: The phrase without praising oneself and disparaging others means that he or she teaches Dharma to sentient beings with a mind that is free of the entanglements of pride and jealousy.

original: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi sems yongs su dag pa'i gtam du shes par bya'o //üîΩso so yang dag rig bsdus phyir //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i rang gi sems yongs su dag pa'i gtam du shes par bya'o // so so yang dag rig bsdus phyir //
translated: These five aspects should be understood as the bodhisattvas‚Äô discourse that is based upon one‚Äôs own mind.üîΩThe perfection of speech should be understood in terms of

original: ngag ni phun sum tshogs shes bya ;
analyzed: ngag ni phun sum tshogs shes bya ;
translated: the inclusion of the forms of perfect knowledge.

original: / sems can don du ngag 'jug ste //üîΩde yang ma 'dres ston pa yi //üîΩrtag par zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par rgyun du yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩma 'dres pa dag ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩbzhi gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩchos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //üîΩso so yang dag par rig pa 'di rnams kyi yul la chos nyid ni /üîΩchos kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi rigs yongs su bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: / sems can don du ngag 'jug ste // de yang ma 'dres ston pa yi // rtag par zhes bya ba ni rgyun mi 'chad par rgyun du yang dag par 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ma 'dres pa dag ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bzhi gang zhe na / 'di lta ste / chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o // so so yang dag par rig pa 'di rnams kyi yul la chos nyid ni / chos kyi ngo bo nyid chos kyi rigs yongs su bsdus pa ste /

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni /üîΩgzugs su rung ba'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni /üîΩgzugs su rung ba'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

original: 'dis ji ltar mtha' gnyis spangs pa nyid bshad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar mtha' gnyis spangs pa nyid bshad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does this passage explain the avoidance of the two extremes?

original: gzugs la sogs pas ni de lta bu yin no zhes mtshan nyid mi 'dra @111b ba brjod pa kha cig gis gzugs la sogs pa la bdag tu sgro btags pa gang yin pa de bstsal to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pas ni de lta bu yin no zhes mtshan nyid mi 'dra @111b ba brjod pa kha cig gis gzugs la sogs pa la bdag tu sgro btags pa gang yin pa de bstsal to //
translated: Some people, by saying that form, etc., is not like that, i.e., not like the self, deny the self that is superimposed upon form, etc.

original: med pa la mtshan nyid med pas skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yang 'di nyid kyis bstsal to //
analyzed: med pa la mtshan nyid med pas skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yang 'di nyid kyis bstsal to //
translated: Since the nonexistent has no characteristics, this passage also denies the extreme of nihilism.

original: chos nyid spyod yul kho na la ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin te ;
analyzed: chos nyid spyod yul kho na la ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin te ;
translated: The meaning of the passage, ‚ÄúThe object of the knowledge of reality is just the object of knowledge,‚Äù is as follows:

original: gzugs de mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan du zin kyang ji srid du rnam par phye ste ma bstan pa de srid du re zhig shes pas yul du bya bar mi nus pas rnam par phye ste brjod pa ni ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yinüîΩpar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs de mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas bstan du zin kyang ji srid du rnam par phye ste ma bstan pa de srid du re zhig shes pas yul du bya bar mi nus pas rnam par phye ste brjod pa ni ji ltar shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yinüîΩpar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Although form, etc., is taught by means of its characteristics, as long as it is not taught by means of its differentiation, it cannot be made an object of knowledge. Therefore, the teaching by means of differentiation should be understood as the means by which it becomes an object of knowledge.

original: shes pa ni 'dir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ni 'dir yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness here is mental consciousness, not visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThus, all objects included in the class of the form-adaptability are shown by the words, ‚Äúeye and form.‚ÄùüîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.

original: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs su rung ba'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i don thams cad ston to //üîΩgo bar byed pa ni chos nyid spyod yul de nyid rnam grangs gang gis brjod pas gzhan dag gis shes pas khong du chud par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang gzugs rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs su rung ba'i rigs kyis bsdus pa'i don thams cad ston to // go bar byed pa ni chos nyid spyod yul de nyid rnam grangs gang gis brjod pas gzhan dag gis shes pas khong du chud par byed pa'o ;
translated: The means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.

original: / go bar byed pa rnam grangs tshad med pa shes pa dag gis sgo du ma nyid do //üîΩ'di thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa bzhi tshan gyi bcu po thams cad la so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: / go bar byed pa rnam grangs tshad med pa shes pa dag gis sgo du ma nyid do // 'di thams cad ni rang gi mtshan nyid la sogs pa bzhi tshan gyi bcu po thams cad la so sor sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.üîΩThe means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to comprehend.

original: rigs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The means of understanding is the very same objective domain of reality, by means of which enumeration is expressed, and by which others are caused to understand and to

original: de chos so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te chos nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos nyid de nyid rigs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de chos so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te chos nyid yul yin pa'i phyir ro // chos nyid de nyid rigs zhes bya ste /
translated: and through the analytical knowledge of phenomena, one understands the characteristics of phenomena.

original: dngos po du ma nye bar sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩso so'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni don so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid kho na'i dbang du byas nas chos nyid spyod yul dang yul yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po du ma nye bar sdud pa yin pa'i phyir ro // so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni don so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba rab tu shes so zhes bya ba yin no // rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'i dbang du byas nas chos nyid spyod yul dang yul yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That reality is called a lineage gotra because it is the collection of many things.üîΩThrough the analytical knowledge of meaning, one understands the classification of phenomena.üîΩIt is the domain of the individual intrinsic identity, and it is the object of the individual intrinsic identity.

original: chos nyid spyod yul ni don yin la de yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu nye bar bzung bas yul du 'gyur bas so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos nyid spyod yul ni don yin la de yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig tu nye bar bzung bas yul du 'gyur bas so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The domain of reality is meaning, and it is the object of the individual intrinsic identity because it is apprehended in some way.

original: sgra ji bzhin du ming du grags pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams ma 'dres par bstan pa rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du ming du grags pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams ma 'dres par bstan pa rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The individual correct knowledge of language is the knowledge of the unmixed teaching of phenomena by means of the intrinsic identity renowned as the literal meaning.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'i dbang du byas nas go bar byed pa yul ma 'dres par bstan pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'i dbang du byas nas go bar byed pa yul ma 'dres par bstan pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: This characteristic is explained by the very teaching of the unmixed domain, which is understood by means of the intrinsic identity alone.

original: @112a * // ming de'i rab tu dbye ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i rgyun /
analyzed: @112a * // ming de'i rab tu dbye ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pas chos rnams kyi mthun pa'i rgyun /
translated: The individual correct knowledge of eloquence is the knowledge of the uninterrupted continuity of the concordant phenomena by means of the intrinsic identity of the classification of those names.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu shes so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is stated because it is said:

original: mtshan nyid 'di yang mthun pa'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di yang mthun pa'i rgyun rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid kyis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: This characteristic is also taught by the uninterrupted continuity of the concordant domain.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The other characteristics should be applied in the same way.

original: 'di dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni bshad pa nyid las gsal bar rab tu phye bar zad do //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni bshad pa nyid las gsal bar rab tu phye bar zad do //
translated: The divisions of these are clearly distinguished in the very explanation.

original: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la ji ltar rigs kyis bsdu ba'i khongs su bsdu bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid la ji ltar rigs kyis bsdu ba'i khongs su bsdu bar bya zhe na /
translated: How are they included in the inclusion by the characteristics of the elements?

original: da ltar byung ba'i rigs su gtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rigs su gtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya bas sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They are included by the statement, ‚Äúbecause they belong to the type of present.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i yul nyid kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyar ba nyid do //üîΩrgyu bzhi dag gis smra ba po'i //
analyzed: shes pa'i yul nyid kyang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyar ba nyid do // rgyu bzhi dag gis smra ba po'i //
translated: The object of consciousness is also included by the statement, ‚Äúin dependence on the past and future.‚Äù

original: phun sum tshogs par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs par 'dod pa yin //
translated: The perfection of the speaker is asserted to be due to four causes.

original: dang po gzugs ni phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: dang po gzugs ni phun sum tshogs //
translated: The first is the perfection of form,

original: gnyis pa ston pas byas pa yin /
analyzed: gnyis pa ston pas byas pa yin /
translated: the second is the perfection of the teacher,

original: len 'debs pa ni gsum pa ste //
analyzed: len 'debs pa ni gsum pa ste //
translated: the third is the perfection of the questioner,

original: bzhi pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa 'dzin pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: and the fourth is the perfection of the listener.

original: de la gzugs phun sum tshogs pa mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la gzugs phun sum tshogs pa mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The perfection of form is applied according to the s≈´tras.

original: de'i las ni 'bras phrag bcu dang ldan pa'i sgra skad kyi yan lag la mkhas pas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste ;
analyzed: de'i las ni 'bras phrag bcu dang ldan pa'i sgra skad kyi yan lag la mkhas pas zhes bya ba nas bzung ste ;
translated: Its action is to hold the ten powers of knowledge, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unhindered knowledge, and the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha, and to be skilled in the branches of speech that are endowed with the ten powers.

original: bskal pa 'bum du bzung ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya bar 'di ni gzungs kyi las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa 'bum du bzung ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya bar 'di ni gzungs kyi las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the action of retention, up to the point where it is said that it is the blessing of having held them for a hundred thousand eons.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni de de lta bu'i gzungs thob cing zhes bya ba nas bzung ste rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re las chos kyi sgo brjod du med pa 'byung bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni de de lta bu'i gzungs thob cing zhes bya ba nas bzung ste rdul phra rab kyi rdul re re las chos kyi sgo brjod du med pa 'byung bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of teaching is indicated by the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúHaving attained such retention,‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúopens the door of Dharma in each atom.‚Äù

original: dris pa len 'debs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: dris pa len 'debs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The perfection of answering questions is indicated by the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúIf someone were to ask him questions,‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhe would be able to answer all those questions.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag gis sems can thams cad la nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mtha' dag gis sems can thams cad la nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of remaining in the world is indicated by the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúIf he so wished,‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúhe would remain in the world with all the activities of a Buddha for the sake of all sentient beings.‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa ni de de bas kyang shas cher zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa phun sum tshogs pa ni de de bas kyang shas cher zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The perfect apprehension is from the wordsüîΩand even more so.üîΩ

original: de lta bu'i shes rab kyi snang ba rnam par nges pa'i spobs pa bdag gis yongs su spyad par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes rab kyi snang ba rnam par nges pa'i spobs pa bdag gis yongs su spyad par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of retention is indicated by the passage beginning with ‚Äúand even more than that‚Äù and ending with ‚ÄúI will make use of the light of such wisdom, the eloquence of ascertainment.‚Äù

original: de ltar bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa ni shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ngag phun sum tshogs @112b pa dang ; smra ba po phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu gsum gyis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa phun sum tshogs pa ni shes pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ngag phun sum tshogs @112b pa dang ; smra ba po phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyu gsum gyis yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfection of explanation is shown by three causes: the perfection of knowledge, the perfection of speech, and the perfection of the speaker.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as before.

original: bdag dang gzhan don bsgrub phyir thugs rjes 'brel ba'i thugs //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan don bsgrub phyir thugs rjes 'brel ba'i thugs //
translated: The compassionate mind, in order to accomplish the aims of self and other,

original: dang por dge mchog 'bad pa chen po mdzad nas ni //
analyzed: dang por dge mchog 'bad pa chen po mdzad nas ni //
translated: first, with great effort, produces the supreme virtue,

original: blo ldan ye shes yon tan mchog ldan brnyes nas su //
analyzed: blo ldan ye shes yon tan mchog ldan brnyes nas su //
translated: and then, the wise one, having attained the supreme qualities of knowledge,

original: sems can bsam pa thibs bo rgyu ba mkhyen mdzad de //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa thibs bo rgyu ba mkhyen mdzad de //
translated: knows the dense jungle of the inclinations of sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten sdug bsngal rgya mtshor ltung ba rab gzigs nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten sdug bsngal rgya mtshor ltung ba rab gzigs nas //
translated: Seeing that the world has fallen into the ocean of suffering,

original: don med thibs po de las yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir //
analyzed: don med thibs po de las yongs su dgrol ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to completely liberate it from that meaningless thicket,

original: sems can bsam pa rnam mang legs par rab brtags te ;
analyzed: sems can bsam pa rnam mang legs par rab brtags te ;
translated: Having thoroughly examined the many different dispositions of sentient beings,

original: /'phags pa'i lam dang mthun pa'i chos ni ston bzhed nas //
analyzed: /'phags pa'i lam dang mthun pa'i chos ni ston bzhed nas //
translated: And wishing to teach the Dharma that is in accord with the noble path,

original: sems can dbang po la sogs mkhas pa mchog thob cing //
analyzed: sems can dbang po la sogs mkhas pa mchog thob cing //
translated: Having attained the highest skill in understanding the faculties of sentient beings and so forth,

original: phun sum tshogs ngag smra po phun sum tshogs mchog brnyes te //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs ngag smra po phun sum tshogs mchog brnyes te //
translated: Having attained the highest perfection of eloquent speech,

original: sems brten rgyu ba thibs po sems can gtogs pa dag / rnam pa mang po brtags nas chos rnams ston par mdzad //
analyzed: sems brten rgyu ba thibs po sems can gtogs pa dag / rnam pa mang po brtags nas chos rnams ston par mdzad //
translated: Having examined the many different states of mind of sentient beings, he teaches the Dharma.

original: so so yang dag rig rnams mang thob nas //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig rnams mang thob nas //
translated: Having attained the many kinds of analytical knowledges,

original: de yis chos rnams tshul bzhin bsam byas te //
analyzed: de yis chos rnams tshul bzhin bsam byas te //
translated: Having properly contemplated the Dharma with those,

original: sa dgu don chen rnam par sbyongs nas ni //
analyzed: sa dgu don chen rnam par sbyongs nas ni //
translated: Having purified the great meaning of the nine grounds,

original: chos kyi sprin ni yang dag gnon par byed //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin ni yang dag gnon par byed //
translated: He ascends to the Cloud of Dharma.

original: sa bcu pa'i 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i 'brel pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the connection to the tenth ground,

original: 'dir sa dgu pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'dir sa dgu pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Here, the ninth stage is called the stage of the one who has entered into the certainty of a bodhisattva.

original: 'di dag ni bshad pa'i mtshams sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bshad pa'i mtshams sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is this a connection to the explanation?

original: tshogs bstsags par bya ba shin tu mtha' yas bstsags pa'i phyir chos dkar po yongs su rdzogs pa yin la /
analyzed: tshogs bstsags par bya ba shin tu mtha' yas bstsags pa'i phyir chos dkar po yongs su rdzogs pa yin la /
translated: The perfection of virtuous qualities is due to the accumulation of the extremely limitless accumulations.

original: de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po shin tu yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po shin tu yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: And that is due to the extremely great retention of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de ltar na mtshams sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mtshams sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the connection.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la khyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen pos shin tu rgyas pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la khyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen pos shin tu rgyas pa thob pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the vast through great compassion is due to the pervasion of one's own and others' purposes.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don la zhugs pa'i phyir zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what was said about engaging in one's own and others' purposes.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams rnam par dbye ba ni sna tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rnams rnam par dbye ba ni sna tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: The variety is the differentiation of the world systems.

original: de la mkhas pa ni bzo ba'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa ni bzo ba'o //
translated: Skill in that is craftsmanship.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he purifies the Buddha-field.

original: sems can rnams kyi khams ni rigs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi khams ni rigs so //
translated: The element of beings is the spiritual gene.

original: de'i rgyu ba thibs po ji skad du bshad pa la zhugs shing rtogs pa ste //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ba thibs po ji skad du bshad pa la zhugs shing rtogs pa ste //
translated: The obscuration of that is the thick growth of the addictions, as previously described.

original: de'i phyir @113a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @113a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yin no //
translated: he brings beings to full maturity.

original: de lta ma yin te rigs ma rtogs na yongs su smin par bya ba dka'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rigs ma rtogs na yongs su smin par bya ba dka'o //
translated: Otherwise, if he did not understand the gene, it would be difficult to bring beings to maturity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni de bzhin nyid do //üîΩde la zhugs pas rtogs pas rjes su mthun par gyur pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul ni de bzhin nyid do // de la zhugs pas rtogs pas rjes su mthun par gyur pa'i 'du shes yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The domain of the Tathagata is suchness.üîΩHe enters it and understands it.

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The perception and attention that are in accord with it are the thoroughly differentiated.üîΩThe superior perception of the powers, etc.

original: phul du phyin pa thob par 'dod pas stobs la sogs pa la lhag par dmigs pa ste chog par 'dzin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phul du phyin pa thob par 'dod pas stobs la sogs pa la lhag par dmigs pa ste chog par 'dzin pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: is the contentment that is the attainment of the perfection of the powers, etc.

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Those who are omniscient in every way are omniscient in every respect.

original: de dag gi ye shes kyis ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / bskal pa ji lta bar sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi ye shes kyis ni sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de bzhin nyid dang / bskal pa ji lta bar sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: Their knowledge is of reality free from all obscurations and of the benefit of sentient beings in accordance with their aspirations.

original: gcig la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / cig shos ni phrin las kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / cig shos ni phrin las kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The former is the object of the knowledge of the path, the latter is the object of the knowledge of the result.

original: de'i phyir sa'i mthar thug pa thob pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa'i mthar thug pa thob pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are so called because they attain the culmination of the stages.

original: dri med la sogs ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: dri med la sogs ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The concentrations of stainlessness and so on

original: bcu tshan so sor thob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bcu tshan so sor thob pa'i phyir //
translated: are attained in each of the ten sets.

original: thob pa las ni ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: thob pa las ni ting nge 'dzin //
translated: From the attainment of the concentrations

original: yongs su rdzogs par thob ces brjod //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par thob ces brjod //
translated: it is said they are fully attained.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams sngar spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rgyang sring bar byed pa'i don gyis dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams sngar spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rgyang sring bar byed pa'i don gyis dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Stainlessness is so called because it is the meaning of distancing affliction, since affliction is previously abandoned.

original: ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba mngon du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dri ma med pa zhes bya ba mngon du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The stainless meditative stabilization called ‚Äústainless‚Äù manifests.

original: ldem po ngag la 'jug pa dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ldem po ngag ni 'dir dgongs pa'i ldem po dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldem po ngag la 'jug pa dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ldem po ngag ni 'dir dgongs pa'i ldem po dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The stainless engagement of interpretable meaning is the interpretable meaning of the intention here.

original: dgongs pa bzhis thub pa'i gsung rab mtha' dag ji lta ba bzhin du 'gal ba med par khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa bzhis thub pa'i gsung rab mtha' dag ji lta ba bzhin du 'gal ba med par khong du chud pa ste /
translated: One should understand that the entire teaching of the Muni is without contradiction, just as it is, by means of the four intentions.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dbye ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dbye ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one called ‚Äúthe entrance into the discrimination of the dharma-dhƒÅtu‚Äù is the teaching.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni 'dir bshad pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni 'dir bshad pa'i chos yin te /
translated: The dharma-dhƒÅtu is the dharma explained here.

original: de mdo sde du ma'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings 'di la bye brag tu dbye bas rnam par phye nas dgongs pa gang zhig gang la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de mdo sde du ma'i rang bzhin gyi chos kyi dbyings 'di la bye brag tu dbye bas rnam par phye nas dgongs pa gang zhig gang la 'jug pa ste /
translated: That is the dharma-dhƒÅtu having the nature of many s≈´tras. Having discriminated it by means of discrimination, one enters into the intention of whatever.

original: thams cad la dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi char yang 'jug pa ni med do //
analyzed: thams cad la dgongs pa rnam pa bzhi char yang 'jug pa ni med do //
translated: All four kinds of intention do not enter into everything.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin gang gis bye brag tu 'jug pa de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dbye ba la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin gang gis bye brag tu 'jug pa de ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dbye ba la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the concentration by which one enters into the differentiation of the dharmadhatu is the concentration of the differentiation of the dharmadhatu.

original: gzhan na re gcig kho na yin pa las 'jig rten gyi @113b bye brag gis tha dad pa don gyi sgo nas gcig pa nyid du sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan na re gcig kho na yin pa las 'jig rten gyi @113b bye brag gis tha dad pa don gyi sgo nas gcig pa nyid du sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is the same as the one, but is differentiated by the world, because it is applied to the same object by means of the distinctions of the world.

original: byang chub mchog tu gyur pa ni byang chub kyi snying po'o //
analyzed: byang chub mchog tu gyur pa ni byang chub kyi snying po'o //
translated: The supreme enlightenment is the site of enlightenment.

original: de las skye ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang la gang dag gis de brgyan par byed rab tu 'byed par byed pa de dag gi tshogs yod pa de /
analyzed: de las skye ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin gang la gang dag gis de brgyan par byed rab tu 'byed par byed pa de dag gi tshogs yod pa de /
translated: Because it arises from that, the concentration in which those who adorn it, who differentiate it, have a collection of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye ba dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye ba dri ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, it is called the stainless near essence.

original: 'di la snying po rgya mtsho lta bu yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la snying po rgya mtsho lta bu yod pa ste /
translated: It has an essence like the ocean.

original: 'di ltar nang gi cha rin po che mthu bla na med pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas dra bar khebs pa can gyi rgya mtsho chen po shin tu rgya che bar gyur pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin kyang yi ge dang don gyi gzungs duüîΩma mnyam par 'jog pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir rgya chen por gyur te gzungs dri ma med pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang gi cha rin po che mthu bla na med pa dpag tu med pa dang ldan pas dra bar khebs pa can gyi rgya mtsho chen po shin tu rgya che bar gyur pa de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin kyang yi ge dang don gyi gzungs du ma mnyam par 'jog pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir rgya chen por gyur te gzungs dri ma med pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: so too the ocean of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is endowed with the great collection of the jewels of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of letters and meanings.üîΩIt is endowed with the ocean,

analyzed: rgya mtsho dang 'dra bar 'byor ba ste /

analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po rin po che'i phung po chen po grangs su dgod pa dpag tu med pa dag gis brgyan pa na 'byor pa shin tu rab kyi mthar phyin pa dang 'brel ba nyams su myong ba de bzhin du mngon par shes pa mthu du
translated: so too the ocean of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is endowed with the great collection of the jewels of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of letters and meanings.üîΩIt is endowed with the ocean,üîΩjust as the great ocean is adorned with an immeasurable collection of precious jewels,üîΩso too the ocean of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is endowed with the great collection of the jewels of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ of letters and meanings.üîΩIt is endowed with the ocean,üîΩjust as the great ocean is adorned with an immeasurable collection of precious jewels,üîΩso too the ocean of dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ is

original: ma dang ldan par mngon par sgrub pa yang dag par skyes pa dag gis ting nge 'dzin dri ma med par byed pa na 'byor pas mnyam par 'jog pa yin te /
analyzed: ma dang ldan par mngon par sgrub pa yang dag par skyes pa dag gis ting nge 'dzin dri ma med par byed pa na 'byor pas mnyam par 'jog pa yin te /
translated: When they have attained the immaculate meditative absorption, they attain meditative equipoise through mastery.

original: mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dri ma med pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa dri ma med pa zhes brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is called the immaculate accomplishment of the superknowledges.

original: mtha' yas pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra bar rgyas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa na zhing rnam par dag pa dri ma med par 'gyur ba ston te /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams dang 'dra bar rgyas pa dang / de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir chos rnams thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa na zhing rnam par dag pa dri ma med par 'gyur ba ston te /
translated: These two verses show that when one attains meditative absorption, the field becomes pure and immaculate.

original: de bzhin du yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is also explained in the same way.

original: tshogs gsum la nges par gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa sbyar ba'i sgo nas rjes su rtogs shing khong du chud na de dang 'tsham par chos ston pas de dag yongs su smin par byed pas ting nge 'dzin la dri ma med pa
analyzed: tshogs gsum la nges par gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa sbyar ba'i sgo nas rjes su rtogs shing khong du chud na de dang 'tsham par chos ston pas de dag yongs su smin par byed pas ting nge 'dzin la dri ma med pa
translated: If they were to understand and realize the mental behavior of all sentient beings who definitely abide in the three assemblies through the door of application, they would ripen them by teaching the Dharma in accordance with them.üîΩ

original: nyid du byed de /
analyzed: nyid du byed de /
translated: If they understand and realize the mental behavior of all sentient beings who definitely abide in the three assemblies through the door of application, they ripen them by teaching the Dharma in accordance with them, and thus they make concentration stainless.

original: de skad du sems can yongs su smin par byed pas dri ma med pa nyid ces smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du sems can yongs su smin par byed pas dri ma med pa nyid ces smras pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said that they are stainless by ripening sentient beings.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la mnyam par gzhag na da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis mnga' ba /üîΩsku dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa gang dag chos zab mo gting @114a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la mnyam par gzhag na da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis mnga' ba / sku dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus brgyan pa gang dag chos zab mo gting @114a * //
translated: When they are equipoised in that concentration, all the present BhagavƒÅn Buddhas, who possess the thirty-two marks of a great being,üîΩwhose bodies are adorned with the eighty minor marks, and who teach the profound Dharma that is difficult to fathom,

original: dpag dka' ba ston par mdzad pa thams cad mngon sum du bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: dpag dka' ba ston par mdzad pa thams cad mngon sum du bzhugs pa ste /
translated: are directly present.

original: de'i phyir de dag gzhan mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mngon du gyur pa shes pa'i phyir shin tu dri ma med par dmigs pa la de skad du mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa dri ma med pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gzhan mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa mngon du gyur pa shes pa'i phyir shin tu dri ma med par dmigs pa la de skad du mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa dri ma med pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, because they know the manifestation of the perfect enlightenment of others, they are said to have the pure object of observation of the knowledge of perfect enlightenment.

original: / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi bya ba ji snyed pa de nyams su myong ba'i phyir sgrub pas ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi bya ba ji snyed pa de nyams su myong ba'i phyir sgrub pas ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they experience all the functions of the concentrations, they are said to have the perfected concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su ma rdzogs pa ni de snyed kyi bya ba nyams su myong ba chub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su ma rdzogs pa ni de snyed kyi bya ba nyams su myong ba chub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they do not have the perfected concentration, they do not experience the full range of functions.

original: de la dbang bskur thob ba ni //
analyzed: de la dbang bskur thob ba ni //
translated: Obtaining the consecration

original: bstan la sogs pa'i skabs nas ni //
analyzed: bstan la sogs pa'i skabs nas ni //
translated: In the section on teaching and so on,

original: ji lta bur na dbang bskur bar //
analyzed: ji lta bur na dbang bskur bar //
translated: how is the consecrationüîΩto be understood?

original: bstan pa las ni rtogs bya ste //
analyzed: bstan pa las ni rtogs bya ste //
translated: From the teaching,

original: stan dang lus kyi tshad dang ni //
analyzed: stan dang lus kyi tshad dang ni //
translated: the seat, the size of the body,üîΩthe retinue, the cause,üîΩand by whom the consecration is conferred,

original: 'khor dang rgyu ni yod pa dang // gang gis dbang ni bskur ba dang // ji zhes bya bar rab ston las //
analyzed: 'khor dang rgyu ni yod pa dang // gang gis dbang ni bskur ba dang // ji zhes bya bar rab ston las //
translated: and what is to be consecrated.

original: mchog gi rang bzhin rin po che chen po rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mchog gi rang bzhin rin po che chen po rnams kyi rgyal por gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: When it is the king of the great jewels of the highest nature,

original: dper na mang dra rnams kyi rgyal po bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na mang dra rnams kyi rgyal po bzhin te /
translated: it is like the king of the wish-fulfilling gems.

original: de dag gi rje bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi rje bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äútheir lord.‚Äù

original: de ltar na mchog gi rang bzhin gyi rin po che chen po rnams dang rgyal po'i padma ni lhan cig rje khol gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mchog gi rang bzhin gyi rin po che chen po rnams dang rgyal po'i padma ni lhan cig rje khol gyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the great jewels of the highest nature and the king of the lotus are to be understood as connected by the characteristic of lord and servant.

original: mchog gi rang bzhin padma'i rgyal po chen po rin po che'i rnam pa thams cad kyis spras pa nyid ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog gi rang bzhin padma'i rgyal po chen po rin po che'i rnam pa thams cad kyis spras pa nyid ni khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The great lotus king of the highest nature, adorned with all the aspects of jewels, is the characteristic of distinction. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i sa nas de byung ba'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i sa nas de byung ba'i phyir sa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is the characteristic of the stage because it arises from the stage that completely transcends all worldly realms.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi spyod yul du 'gyur ba gang yin pa ni gzung ba'i rkyen du snang ba'i phyir yul nyid du 'gyur te de de ltar yongs su grub pas grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi spyod yul du 'gyur ba gang yin pa ni gzung ba'i rkyen du snang ba'i phyir yul nyid du 'gyur te de de ltar yongs su grub pas grub pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The object that is the nature of illusion is the object condition, and thus it is the object. Since it is established in that way, it is the characteristic of establishment.

original: chos kyi dbyings la shin tu gnas shing bkod par snang bas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la shin tu gnas shing bkod par snang bas don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Since it appears as the array that is well-established in the dharmadhatu, it is the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: shin tu gnas pa ni legs par gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsgyur ba rnams ni don du ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shin tu gnas pa ni legs par gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsgyur ba rnams ni don du ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Well-established is well-placed. Since prefixes have many meanings,

original: rab stsogs don ni bsdus pa la //
analyzed: rab stsogs don ni bsdus pa la //
translated: the meaning of pra is included in su.

original: bdag gis don gang rgyus shes te //üîΩmkhas pas 'jig rten rig byed kyi //
analyzed: bdag gis don gang rgyus shes te // mkhas pas 'jig rten rig byed kyi //
translated: I know the meaning of su through its cause.üîΩThe wise know it through many applications

original: sbyor bas du mar shes par bya //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: sbyor bas du mar shes par bya // zhes bshad do //
translated: of the knowledge of the world.

original: 'di las 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i @114b rgyur gyur pa legs par bshad pa rnams rig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di las 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i @114b rgyur gyur pa legs par bshad pa rnams rig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the well-explained causes of mundane and supramundane happiness are known from this treatise,

original: 'di ni rig byed yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyis bka' yang rig byed yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rig byed yin no zhes bya ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyis bka' yang rig byed yin no //
translated: Just as the Vedas are the means of knowing the past, so the Buddha's word is the means of knowing the past.

original: lhag ma ni shes par sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni shes par sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye ba'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: bdag nyid chen po brten pa'i blo //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po brten pa'i blo //
translated: The great being is the one who has the mind of reliance,

original: snying brtse ba dang nges pa'i rgyud //
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang nges pa'i rgyud //
translated: the one who has compassion, the one who has the lineage,

original: sems can kun gyi gnyen gcig pa //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi gnyen gcig pa //
translated: the one who is the friend of all beings,

original: go cha chen po bgos pa'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa'o //
translated: the one who is armed with the great armor.

original: sems can kun la phan bzhed pa //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan bzhed pa //
translated: The one who wishes to benefit all beings,

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa'i rgyu //
translated: the one who is the cause of attaining Buddhahood,

original: dka' ba'i las ni sna tshogs pa //
analyzed: dka' ba'i las ni sna tshogs pa //
translated: the one who is engaged in various difficult tasks,

original: mi bzad rtag tu rjes 'brang ba //üîΩyun ring dus nas bstsags rnams kyis //
analyzed: mi bzad rtag tu rjes 'brang ba // yun ring dus nas bstsags rnams kyis //
translated: the one who is always followed by the unbearable,üîΩthe one who is the object of the accumulations

original: gang gi don du rab sbyar ba //
analyzed: gang gi don du rab sbyar ba //
translated: that have been gathered over a long time,üîΩthe one who is consecrated

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di //
translated: by the bodhisattvas

original: theg pa chen po'i dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: with the consecration of the Great Vehicle.

original: de lta bur ni dbang bskur cing //
analyzed: de lta bur ni dbang bskur cing //
translated: The one who is consecrated in this way,

original: tshad med yon tan ldan pa ste //
analyzed: tshad med yon tan ldan pa ste //
translated: the one who possesses immeasurable good qualities,

original: chos kyi sprin la rab gnas pa'i //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la rab gnas pa'i //
translated: the one who is well-established in the Dharma cloud,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'o //
translated: is called a bodhisattva.

original: dbang bskur ba thob pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the way to obtain the consecration.

original: cho ba nyid kyi mthar phyin pa //
analyzed: cho ba nyid kyi mthar phyin pa //
translated: The perfection of the consecration isüîΩwisdom, liberation,

original: shes rab dang ni rnam thar dang // ting 'dzin gzugs dang mngon par shes //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni rnam thar dang // ting 'dzin gzugs dang mngon par shes //
translated: concentration, form, and superknowledge.

original: don lnga dag la brjod pa yin //
analyzed: don lnga dag la brjod pa yin //
translated: These are the five meanings.

original: don lnga dang 'brel bar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni re re zhing don re re dang 'brel bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: don lnga dang 'brel bar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni re re zhing don re re dang 'brel bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The five meanings should be understood as related to each other.

original: shes bya'i de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byed pa ni shes pa'i che ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byed pa ni shes pa'i che ba nyid yin no //
translated: The greatness of knowledge is that which causes the realization of the reality of the knowable, which is the nature of non-error.

original: de la dang po ni thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la the tshom za ba gcod pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la the tshom za ba gcod pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The first is from the perspective of cutting through doubt about omniscience.

original: chos kyi khams yang dag par 'grub ba zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams yang dag par 'grub ba zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is said about the correct establishment of the element of dharmas.

original: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba rnams so //
translated: Dharmas are the defiled and purified.

original: de dag gi khams ni sa bon te yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi khams ni sa bon te yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Their realm is the seed, because it is said that they are truly established.

original: de rab tu shes pas de nyid kyi phyir yang dag par 'grub pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de rab tu shes pas de nyid kyi phyir yang dag par 'grub pa shes pa yin no //
translated: Because he knows them, he is the one who knows true establishment.

original: srid pa'i yan lag gang dag gis srog chags rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /üîΩgang dag 'gags pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de dag shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag gang dag gis srog chags rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing / gang dag 'gags pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de dag shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he knows which members of cyclic existence afflict living beingsüîΩand which, when ceased, purify them.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bshes pa nyid yang dag par 'grub par shes pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bshes pa nyid yang dag par 'grub par shes pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: He is the one who knows the establishment of the knowledge of dependent origination.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rab tu sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rab tu sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is the one who accomplishes omniscience.

original: gang du zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du ste /üîΩmdo @115a * //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya ba ni khams gsum du ste / mdo @115a * //
translated: Where? In the three realms,

original: las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as the sutra states.

original: sems can gang dag ni sems can gyi khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gang dag ni sems can gyi khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that living beings are the establishment of the realm of living beings.

original: sems gang kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par byang ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gang kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par byang ba ni rnam par shes pa'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind that is defiled and purified establishes the consciousness element.‚Äù

original: gang dag mi shes pa dang shes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag mi shes pa dang shes pa ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúIgnorance and knowledge establish the elements of the compounded and the uncompounded.‚Äù

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i yul ji tsam pa ni nam mkha'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i yul ji tsam pa ni nam mkha'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe extent of the object that is like space establishes the space element.‚Äù

original: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa gang gis ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa gang gis ni yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe teaching of the holy Dharma and the teaching of the non-Dharma establish the elements of the true and the false.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa gang thob pa dang ma thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa gang thob pa dang ma thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúThe attainment and non-attainment of nirvana establish the element of nirvana.‚Äù

original: lta ba'i nyes pa gang gis mu stegs can rnams kyis de mi thob pa ni lta bar gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa gang gis mu stegs can rnams kyis de mi thob pa ni lta bar gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fault of view is that tƒ´rthikas do not attain it, because it is said, ‚ÄúThe establishment of the affliction of view.‚Äù

original: snod kyi 'jig rten 'byung ba dang ldog pa gang dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang 'chags pa yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten 'byung ba dang ldog pa gang dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig pa dang 'chags pa yang dag par 'grub pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The arising and cessation of the world of the environment is the establishment of the destruction and formation of the world system.

original: theg pa gsum yang dag par 'grub pa gang yin pa ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: theg pa gsum yang dag par 'grub pa gang yin pa ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The establishment of the three vehicles is as it is said in the s≈´tras.

original: gnyis pa ni de la gnas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pas sprul pa mngon par bsgrub nus pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de la gnas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas pas sprul pa mngon par bsgrub nus pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The second is from the perspective of the ability of those abiding in that to manifest emanations through abiding in omniscience.

original: sems can du sprul pa la sogs pa'i bye brag las sems can sprul pa'i las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni bskal pa 'dra bar nye bar 'gro bas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can du sprul pa la sogs pa'i bye brag las sems can sprul pa'i las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba ni bskal pa 'dra bar nye bar 'gro bas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The action of creating sentient beings is known as it really is through the various kinds of emanations of sentient beings, etc.

original: nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa gang zhig lus dang ngag gi las nyon mongs pas thebs pas bskyod pa lta bur 'dug pa ste lta bar gyur ba'i sprul pa kun du ston pa yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs par gyur pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa gang zhig lus dang ngag gi las nyon mongs pas thebs pas bskyod pa lta bur 'dug pa ste lta bar gyur ba'i sprul pa kun du ston pa yang de dang 'dra bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The emanation of defilement is that emanation which is as if moved by the karma of defilement of the actions of body and speech. The emanation of views should be understood in the same way.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i dbang gis 'jig rten gyi khams sprul pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The world-realm emanation is that emanation of a world-realm which is created through the power of disciples.

original: rnam par gzhig pa'i chos la 'jug pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa la 'jug @115b pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par gzhig pa'i chos la 'jug pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sogs pa la 'jug @115b pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The entry into the Dharma of destruction is the entry into the four noble truths, etc.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa sprul pa ni rnam par grol ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrtog pa med pa nyid du ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa sprul pa ni rnam par grol ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i phyir ro // rtog pa med pa nyid du ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The emanations of sravakas, etc. are for the sake of disciplining those who are to be disciplined in accordance with their own liberation.

original: gsum pa ni sprul pa de nyid de lta de ltar byed nus pa'i dbang du byas pa ste //
analyzed: gsum pa ni sprul pa de nyid de lta de ltar byed nus pa'i dbang du byas pa ste //
translated: The third is from the point of view of the ability of that emanation to act in such and such a way.

original: de yang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: And that is as it occurs in the sutra.

original: bzhi pa de yi byin rlabs dang // sprul pa la ni 'jug pa ste //üîΩgnyis min ye shes tshul gyis na //
analyzed: bzhi pa de yi byin rlabs dang // sprul pa la ni 'jug pa ste // gnyis min ye shes tshul gyis na //
translated: The fourth is the entry into the transformation of the basis and the entry into the emanation.üîΩThe entry into the transformation of the basis is by way of the nondual intuition.

original: dus kun du ni 'jug pa yin //üîΩmdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dus kun du ni 'jug pa yin // mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The entry into the emanation is by way of the dual intuition.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings shes pa ste cha phra ba la zhes bya ba 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni chos kyi dbyings shes pa ste cha phra ba la zhes bya ba 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The entry into the transformation of the basis is by way of the nondual intuition, because it is the intuition of the reality realm, and it is subtle, since it is the entry into the subtle.

original: lnga pa ni sems can yongs su ma smin pa skrag pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: lnga pa ni sems can yongs su ma smin pa skrag pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The fifth is for the sake of frightening sentient beings who are not ripe.

original: gsang ba'i gnas shes pa dang bskal pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa dag kyang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas shes pa dang bskal pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa dag kyang mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the secret and the knowledge of the eon should be understood as they are described in the sutra.

original: gsang ba'i gnas shes pa zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i rgyu shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas shes pa zhes bya ba ni gsang ba'i rgyu shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge of the secret is the knowledge of the cause of the secret.

original: 'di la 'bras bu rnams gnas pas na gnas pa'i rgyu kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la 'bras bu rnams gnas pas na gnas pa'i rgyu kho nar brjod do //
translated: Here, the cause is called the secret because the results are hidden in it.

original: gsang ba ni gsang bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni gsang bar bya ba ste /
translated: The secret is what should be kept secret.

original: dbang po dang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams la kun du bstan par mi bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang po dang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa rnams la kun du bstan par mi bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It should not be revealed to those whose faculties and roots of virtue are not ripe.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag gis ma rtogs te ma mos nas dam pa'i chos spangs pas chos kyi phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bstsags na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ma rtogs te ma mos nas dam pa'i chos spangs pas chos kyi phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bstsags na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if they do not understand it and do not have faith in it, they abandon the true Dharma, and it is not suitable for them to accumulate karma that would lead to poverty of the Dharma.

original: tshe la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because of mastery over life

original: byin rlob de bzhin gtong ba dang // gnyen po nye bar ston pa ni //
analyzed: byin rlob de bzhin gtong ba dang // gnyen po nye bar ston pa ni //
translated: The sixth and seventh powers are respectivelyüîΩthe knowledge of the bestowal of complete knowing and the knowledge of the teaching of the antidote.üîΩWhat is the power of the knowledge of the right and wrong paths?

original: drug pa dang ni bdun par gzhag / yang dag par gzhol ba 'di ci zhig ce na /üîΩmnyam pa nyid du mos pa nyid do //üîΩde nyid kyi phyir bskal ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: drug pa dang ni bdun par gzhag / yang dag par gzhol ba 'di ci zhig ce na / mnyam pa nyid du mos pa nyid do // de nyid kyi phyir bskal ba la 'jug pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: It is the knowledge of the right and wrong paths in relation to the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere is the knowledge of the paths that lead to the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of various higher and lower faculties is the knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of those in the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of various acquired resolutions is the knowledge of the various acquired resolutions of those in the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of various acquired elements is the knowledge of the various acquired elements of those in the three vehicles.

original: bskal pa du mar bskal pa gcig mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir la /üîΩgcig tu yang bskal pa du ma mnyam pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa du mar bskal pa gcig mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir la / gcig tu yang bskal pa du ma mnyam pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of the knowledge of the recollection of former existences is the knowledge of one's own and others' former existences.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the death and rebirth of all beings.

original: tshe gtang ba'am byin gyis rlob pa la yang dbang 'byor ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshe gtang ba'am byin gyis rlob pa la yang dbang 'byor ba nyid yin no //
