translated: The power of the knowledge of the termination of contamination is the knowledge of the termination of contamination of oneself and others.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of the teaching that brings about the retention and rejection of all is the knowledge of the retention and rejection of all the teachings of the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of the right and wrong paths is the knowledge of the right and wrong paths in relation to the three vehicles.

original: lam la gzud pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: lam la gzud pa shes pa ni /
translated: The power of the knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere is the knowledge of the paths that lead to the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of various higher and lower faculties is the knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of those in the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of various acquired resolutions is the knowledge of the various acquired resolutions of those in the three vehicles.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of various acquired elements is the knowledge of the various acquired elements of those in the three vehicles.

original: gnyen po bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa la byis ba'i lam gyis gzud pa mkhyen pa zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas pa ste so so'i skye bo rnams ni byis pa yin pa'i phyir @116a * //
analyzed: gnyen po bstan pa'i dbang du byas pa la byis ba'i lam gyis gzud pa mkhyen pa zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa ni so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas pa ste so so'i skye bo rnams ni byis pa yin pa'i phyir @116a * //
translated: The power of the knowledge of the recollection of former existences is the knowledge of one's own and others' former existences.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the death and rebirth of all beings.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of the termination of contamination is the knowledge of the termination of contamination of oneself and others.üîΩThe power of the knowledge of the teaching that brings about the retention and rejection of all is the knowledge of the retention and rejection of all the teachings of the three vehicles.

original: byis pa'i sa'i gnyen po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrdul phra rab kyi rdul gyis gzung bar mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal spyod pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste rtsis mkhas pa nyid kyi nga rgyal gyi gnyen po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i sa'i gnyen po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro // rdul phra rab kyi rdul gyis gzung bar mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal spyod pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste rtsis mkhas pa nyid kyi nga rgyal gyi gnyen po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the antidote to the stage of the child.üîΩThe knowledge of the atom and dust is for the sake of those who are proud, in order to teach the antidote to the pride of being skilled in calculation.

original: zhing ni tshogs mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas gzud pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni mtho ris la mos pa'i gnyen po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing ni tshogs mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pas gzud pa mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni mtho ris la mos pa'i gnyen po nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of the field, which is the introduction to the realization of the assembly, is for the sake of those who are devoted to the higher realms, in order to teach the antidote to that devotion.

original: lhag ma gzhan ni rnam par rtog pa spyod pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan ni rnam par rtog pa spyod pa rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The other remaining knowledges are for the sake of those who are conceptual.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood according to the sutras.üîΩThe knowledge of the liberations, concentrations,

original: rnam par thar dang ting 'dzin dang / gzungs dang mngon par shes rnams kyi //
analyzed: rnam par thar dang ting 'dzin dang / gzungs dang mngon par shes rnams kyi //
translated: powers of retention, and higher perceptions,

original: rnam pa dbye ba'i bstan tshul yang //
analyzed: rnam pa dbye ba'i bstan tshul yang //
translated: the way of teaching their classifications,

original: mdo nyid las ni rtogs par bya //
analyzed: mdo nyid las ni rtogs par bya //
translated: should be understood from the sutras themselves.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: re zhig rnam par thar pa rnams la rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi dbang du byas pa ste rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs pa mngon par bsgrub pas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par
analyzed: re zhig rnam par thar pa rnams la rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul gyi dbang du byas pa ste rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs pa mngon par bsgrub pas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par
translated: For a while, with regard to the liberations, he obtains the liberation called inconceivable liberation, which is from the perspective of the domain of supernatural power, since he accomplishes various kinds of supernatural powers.üîΩ

original: thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid yin no //
translated: The phrase for a while, with regard to the liberations, he attains the liberation called 'inconceivable,' refers to the sphere of the supernatural powers. The bodhisattva's liberation is inconceivable because he accomplishes various supernatural transformations.

original: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams dang 'gro ba mtha' yas par smos nas shes pa thogs pa med pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams dang 'gro ba mtha' yas par smos nas shes pa thogs pa med pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he attains the liberation called 'unobstructed,' refers to the unobstructed knowledge of infinite world-realms and beings.

original: rnam par dag pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa slob ba dang mi slob pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa slob ba dang mi slob pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he attains the liberation called 'discernment of purity,' refers to the knowledge of the two kinds of mundane and supramundane liberation, that of the trainee and that of the adept.

original: sgo kun du snang ba zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ci 'dod dgur bsgyur ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: sgo kun du snang ba zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po ci 'dod dgur bsgyur ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The appearance in all doors is from the perspective of transforming things into whatever is desired.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod ces bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gzungs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod ces bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gzungs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The treasury of the tathagatas is from the perspective of the dharani of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mdzod gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mdzod gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the treasury of the tathagatas?

original: theg pa chen po'i chos shin tu rgyas pa'i sde'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos shin tu rgyas pa'i sde'o //
translated: It is the Mahayana Dharma of the vaipulya.

original: 'khor lo thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo thogs pa med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The wheel that is unimpeded is from the perspective of defeating opponents.

original: phas kyi rgol ba dag tshar gcod na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba dag tshar gcod na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi 'khor lo thogs pa med par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When opponents are defeated, the Dharma wheel of the Bhagavat Buddhas turns without impediment.

original: dus gsum gyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni dus gsum dag gi bskal ba gang dag yin pa @116b de dag ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byin gyis rlob pa ste /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rjes su song ba zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni dus gsum dag gi bskal ba gang dag yin pa @116b de dag ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byin gyis rlob pa ste /
translated: The phrase pervading the three times means that he has the power to transform the eons of the three times in any way he wishes.

original: 'das pa yang da ltar du bya bar 'dren par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa yang da ltar du bya bar 'dren par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase he brings the past into the present and so on is made in reference to this.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po can zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa'i dbang du byas pa ste khams ni rigs te rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po can zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos rnams thams cad kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rnam pa thams cad shes pa'i dbang du byas pa ste khams ni rigs te rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the essence of the realm of phenomena means that he has the power to know all the aspects of the dependent origination of all phenomena. The term realm means a family or a cause.

original: rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor snang ba zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni lus med cing snang ba tsam gyis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dkyil 'khor snang ba zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni lus med cing snang ba tsam gyis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The phrase the light of the circle of liberation means that he has the power to pervade with his formless and mere appearance.

original: yul ma lus pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi sems cig car shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yul ma lus pa zhes bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi sems cig car shes pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúall objects,‚Äù this refers to the simultaneous cognition of the minds of sentient beings in infinite world-realms.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'bum dag dang / gzungs 'bum dag dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa 'bum dag gi bar du 'thob bo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i mthar phyin pa yang mdo kho na las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin 'bum dag dang / gzungs 'bum dag dang / mngon par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa 'bum dag gi bar du 'thob bo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'i mthar phyin pa yang mdo kho na las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one attains a hundred thousand meditative absorptions, a hundred thousand dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s, and so forth, up to the accomplishment of a hundred thousand superknowledges.

original: sa yi nges tshig sprin dang ni //
analyzed: sa yi nges tshig sprin dang ni //
translated: The etymology of the levels is as follows:üîΩThey are called ‚Äúclouds of Dharma‚Äù and so forthüîΩBecause they are similar to clouds and so forth

original: chos mthun rnam pa gsum zhes bya //
analyzed: chos mthun rnam pa gsum zhes bya //
translated: In three respects.

original: dper na sprin gyis nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: dper na sprin gyis nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: Just as clouds pervade the sky,

original: thos pa'i chos kyis chang gi lus //üîΩkhyab pa'i phyir na de bzhin du //
analyzed: thos pa'i chos kyis chang gi lus // khyab pa'i phyir na de bzhin du //
translated: So the Dharma pervades the body.

original: khyab par chos mthun dang por bshad //
analyzed: khyab par chos mthun dang por bshad //
translated: This is the first similarity,üîΩThat of pervasiveness.

original: khyab pa ni sprin gyis nam mkha' bzhin du thob pa'i chos kyis sa 'di pa'i lus la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni sprin gyis nam mkha' bzhin du thob pa'i chos kyis sa 'di pa'i lus la khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma that is attained pervades the body of this level, just as clouds pervade the sky.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i blo dang ji skad bshad ma thag pa tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa'i blo dang ji skad bshad ma thag pa tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The one who possesses such knowledge has the intelligence, as was just explained, that is called ‚Äúhaving gone beyond the immeasurables.

original: mang po dang cha phra ba dang myur du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mang po dang cha phra ba dang myur du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù How is it that he can apprehend many things, subtle things, and things quickly?

original: de phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de phyogs bcu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: He can apprehend the dharmas of the ten directions, etc.

original: skad cig thang cig yud tsam smos pa ni dus thung du shes par bya ba'i phyir te nyan pa po'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig yud tsam smos pa ni dus thung du shes par bya ba'i phyir te nyan pa po'i dbang gis rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: The terms ‚Äúmoment,‚Äù ‚Äúinstant,‚Äù and ‚Äúbrief period‚Äù are used to indicate a short period of time, and the three are mentioned in accordance with the capacity of the listener.

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad med pa smos pas ni mang po 'dzin pa'i sgo nas bstan pa tsam gyis 'dzin pa'i nus pa de yongs su bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po tshad med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshad med pa smos pas ni mang po 'dzin pa'i sgo nas bstan pa tsam gyis 'dzin pa'i nus pa de yongs su bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúimmeasurable great illumination of the Dharma‚Äù indicates that the power of apprehension is taught by the mere mention of the apprehension of many things, etc.

original: rgyas par ni 'og nas 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying po nyid kyis rgya mtsho'i dpe gnyis dang / 'on kyang dpe bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i gzhung gi dpes 'chad par 'gyur ro //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin @117a * //
analyzed: rgyas par ni 'og nas 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying po nyid kyis rgya mtsho'i dpe gnyis dang / 'on kyang dpe bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs ba'i gzhung gi dpes 'chad par 'gyur ro // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin @117a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe two similes of the ocean, and so on, are taught by the noble Vajragarbha himself, but the similes are taught here. ‚Äù

original: gshegs pa'i gsang ba la 'jug pa gang dag yin pa zhes 'byung ba de la de bzhin gshegs pa smos pa ni myur du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa'i gsang ba la 'jug pa gang dag yin pa zhes 'byung ba de la de bzhin gshegs pa smos pa ni myur du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe secret of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äù refers to the fact that the tathƒÅgatas are quickly grasped.

original: gsang ba smos pa ni phra ba 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba smos pa ni phra ba 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúsecret‚Äù refers to the fact that they are grasped subtly.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin gyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin gyis she na /
translated: How is it by nature?

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po zhes bya bas thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa smos par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po zhes bya bas thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa smos par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúgreat light of the Dharma‚Äù refers to the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it by nature?

original: snang bar gyur bas chos so sor snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bar gyur bas chos so sor snang bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is by nature a light because it illuminates the Dharma.

original: gsal bar gyur ba nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur ba nyid kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it by nature a manifestation?

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa smos par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa smos par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because it would be mentioned as the knowledge that arises from cultivation.

original: chos kyi gsal ba chen po zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi gsal ba chen po zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the great light of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar las kyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar las kyis she na /
translated: How is it by action?

original: dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi char 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it rains down the rain of the true Dharma.

original: mos pa'i sgo nas ni bzod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni tshig 'bru 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩbdag gir byed do zhas bya ba ni don 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mos pa'i sgo nas ni bzod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni tshig 'bru 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so // bdag gir byed do zhas bya ba ni don 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is said that one has forbearance through devotion.üîΩIt is said that one takes it up through the words.üîΩIt is said that one appropriates it through the meaning.

original: yang dag par 'dzin to zhe bya ba ni /üîΩde gnyi ga 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin to zhe bya ba ni / de gnyi ga 'dzin pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: It is said that one holds it through both.

original: da ni 'dzin ba'i nus pa de dpe gnyis dang dpes 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni 'dzin ba'i nus pa de dpe gnyis dang dpes 'chad de /
translated: Now, the ability to hold that is explained through two examples and a summary.

original: dang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i sgo nas ni bzod do //
analyzed: dang bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i sgo nas ni bzod do //
translated: It is said that one has forbearance through the door of the thing that causes faith.

original: go skabs 'byed pa'i sgo nas ni yang dag par len to //
analyzed: go skabs 'byed pa'i sgo nas ni yang dag par len to //
translated: It is said that one takes it up through the door of opportunity.

original: de las gzhan pa'i chu'i grangs 'grib bar byed pa'i sgo nas ni bdag gir byed do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chu'i grangs 'grib bar byed pa'i sgo nas ni bdag gir byed do //
translated: It is said that one appropriates it through the door of diminishing the number of other waters.üîΩIt is said that one holds it through the door of the thing that causes faith.

original: spyad pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i sgo nas ni yang dag par 'dzin to zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyad pa'i 'os ma yin pa'i sgo nas ni yang dag par 'dzin to zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the bodhisattvas are not receptive to the teachings in a manner that is suitable for practice.

original: dus gsum gyi brjod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi brjod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi brjod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi brjod pa'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The basis of the expression of the three times means the basis of the expression of the past, future, and present.

original: gong du rgyas par ni 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying pos rgya mtsho'i dpe gnyis dang dpes 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gong du rgyas par ni 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying pos rgya mtsho'i dpe gnyis dang dpes 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The extensive explanation above is what the noble Vajragarbha said in the commentary on the example of the ocean with two examples.

original: re zhig de lta bu ni sprin dang chos mthun pas khyab pa'i sgo nas sa'i nges pa'i tshig dang po yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig de lta bu ni sprin dang chos mthun pas khyab pa'i sgo nas sa'i nges pa'i tshig dang po yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the first definition of the stages should be understood in terms of their pervasion, which is similar to a cloud.

original: gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second is

original: nyon mongs pa'i rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sgo nas chos mthun pa ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rdul rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i sgo nas chos mthun pa ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin te /
translated: the similarity in terms of pacifying the dust of afflictions, as stated in the sutra.

original: 'dir smon lam gyis snying brtse ba dang snying rje chen po sprin chen po kun nas bslang ste zhes bya ba ni sprin dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir smon lam gyis snying brtse ba dang snying rje chen po sprin chen po kun nas bslang ste zhes bya ba ni sprin dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Here, the great cloud of compassion and great compassion is aroused by the vow, which is like a cloud.

original: chos kyi snang ba chen po bsgrags ba'i 'brug sgrog pa zhes bya ba ni 'brug sgrog pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba chen po bsgrags ba'i 'brug sgrog pa zhes bya ba ni 'brug sgrog pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The great light of the Dharma is proclaimed by the sound of thunder, which is like thunder.

original: mngon bar shes @117b pa dang rig pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i glog 'gyu ba zhes bya ba ni glog dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mngon bar shes @117b pa dang rig pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i glog 'gyu ba zhes bya ba ni glog dang 'dra'o //
translated: The superknowledges, the knowledges, and the fearlessnesses are like lightning flashes.

original: rlung gis shin tu bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni rlung lta bu'o //
analyzed: rlung gis shin tu bskyod pa zhes bya ba ni rlung lta bu'o //
translated: The wind blows very hard, which is like the wind.

original: bsod nams ye shes kyi sprin gyi dra ba stug po chen pos kun du khebs pa zhes bya ba ni sprin gyi dra bas 'khrigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes kyi sprin gyi dra ba stug po chen pos kun du khebs pa zhes bya ba ni sprin gyi dra bas 'khrigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The great thick net of the cloud of merit and knowledge completely covers, which is like a net of clouds.

original: lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sprin 'khyil pa kun du ston pa zhes bya ba ni klong 'khyil ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: lus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sprin 'khyil pa kun du ston pa zhes bya ba ni klong 'khyil ba lta bu'o //
translated: The cloud of various kinds of bodies is displayed, which is like a whirlpool.

original: chos kyi sgra chen po sgrog pa zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i sgra lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgra chen po sgrog pa zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i sgra lta bu'o //
translated: The great sound of the Dharma is proclaimed, which is like the sound of rain.

original: bdud kyi phyogs shin tu tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sgra chen po sgrog pa yang dag par bstan pa shes par bya'o //üîΩsprin dang chos mthun sgrol sgo nas //
analyzed: bdud kyi phyogs shin tu tshar gcod pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sgra chen po sgrog pa yang dag par bstan pa shes par bya'o // sprin dang chos mthun sgrol sgo nas //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúcompletely destroying the forces of Mara‚Äù should be understood as referring to the proclamation of the great sound of Dharma.

original: sa yi nges tshig shes bya ste //
analyzed: sa yi nges tshig shes bya ste //
translated: The stages of the spiritual levels should be understood in terms of their similarity to clouds.

original: sprin gyi char gyis lo tog dag / sgrol ba bzhin du dga' ldan gyi //üîΩgnas la sogs pa'i rim gyis ni //
analyzed: sprin gyi char gyis lo tog dag / sgrol ba bzhin du dga' ldan gyi // gnas la sogs pa'i rim gyis ni //
translated: Just as clouds release rain and cause crops to grow,üîΩso the spiritual levels cause sentient beings to be delivered

original: sems can rnams ni sgrol ba yin //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni sgrol ba yin //
translated: through the stages of the Abode of Joy and so forth.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to ;
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to ;
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúin a single world system‚Äù and so forth.

original: / mthu ni bla na med pa dang // bla med nyid ni gnas la sogs //üîΩrab du bstan phyir rgyas bshad pa'i //
analyzed: / mthu ni bla na med pa dang // bla med nyid ni gnas la sogs // rab du bstan phyir rgyas bshad pa'i //
translated: Power is unexcelled, and the unexcelled is the stages of the abodes and so forth.üîΩThe extensive explanation is for the sake of clearly revealing

original: sgo drug dag gis rab tu bstan //
analyzed: sgo drug dag gis rab tu bstan //
translated: the six topics.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?üîΩThe stages of the spiritual levels are to be understood in terms of six topics:

original: gnas dang gzhi dang mtshan nyid dang // de bzhin du ni bya ba dang // yongs tshim de bzhin rgya chen te //
analyzed: gnas dang gzhi dang mtshan nyid dang // de bzhin du ni bya ba dang // yongs tshim de bzhin rgya chen te //
translated: abode, basis, characteristics, activities,üîΩsatisfaction, and vast extent.

original: 'di skad gcig ni rgyu bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad gcig ni rgyu bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the condensed meaning of the verse.

original: rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni gong nas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba 'thob po zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni gong nas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba 'thob po zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable liberation is the inconceivable liberation of the bodhisattva.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang gnas 'di snga ma dang mthun bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang gnas 'di snga ma dang mthun bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be applied to the other liberations in accordance with the above.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: rnam par thar pa la sogs pas sngar rab tu bstan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la sogs pas sngar rab tu bstan pa kho na yin no //
translated: the liberations and so on have already been fully explained.

original: dog pa dang yangs pa dag tu yongs su bsgyur ba ni dog pa dang yangs par yongs su bsgyur ba ste /
analyzed: dog pa dang yangs pa dag tu yongs su bsgyur ba ni dog pa dang yangs par yongs su bsgyur ba ste /
translated: The transformation of the small into the large and the transformation of the large into the small are the transformation of the small into the large and the transformation of the large into the small.

original: yongs su bsgyur ba ni bzlog pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su bsgyur ba ni bzlog pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Transformation means the state of reversal.

original: dog pa yangs par byed pa dang yangs bdog par byed ba ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dog pa yangs par byed pa dang yangs bdog par byed ba ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The transformation of the small into the large and the transformation of the large into the small should be understood as they are described in the sutras.

original: bya ba mchod pa'i sgo nas ni //
analyzed: bya ba mchod pa'i sgo nas ni //
translated: Through the gateway of worship,

original: byang chub chogs ni stsogs phyir te //
analyzed: byang chub chogs ni stsogs phyir te //
translated: the accumulations of enlightenment are gathered.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung bzhin no //üîΩyongs mgu bya ba the tshom du //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung bzhin no // yongs mgu bya ba the tshom du //
translated: As it is said in the sutra.

original: gyur ba rnams la mthu bstan pas //
analyzed: gyur ba rnams la mthu bstan pas //
translated: The power of the buddhas is shown to those who have doubtsüîΩabout the complete satisfaction of beings.

original: mdo dang mthun par khod du chud par bya'o //üîΩ@118a * // rgya chen mthu dang grangs kyis ni //
analyzed: mdo dang mthun par khod du chud par bya'o // @118a * // rgya chen mthu dang grangs kyis ni //
translated: It should be understood in accordance with the sutra.üîΩIt should be understood as twofold:

original: rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya //
translated: by its vastness and by its number.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as it is said in the sutra.

original: da ni grangs rgya che ba de nyid rab tu bsten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni grangs rgya che ba de nyid rab tu bsten pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate just that vast number,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa mtha' dag bstan par mi nus pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa mtha' dag bstan par mi nus pa nyid du shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that the stage of the tathagatas is beyond all enumeration,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i yul gyi byin gyi rlabs te de ltar tshad med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul dang yul la 'jug pa ci 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa'i yul gyi byin gyi rlabs te de ltar tshad med na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul dang yul la 'jug pa ci 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs
translated: the bodhisattva Vimuktasena said, ‚ÄúO son of the victors, if the domain of the bodhisattvas is so immeasurable, what is the engagement of the tathagatas and their domain like?‚Äù

original: pa smras so //
analyzed: pa smras so //
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe non-duality of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs body, speech, and mind‚Äù means

original: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: that the dharmadhƒÅtu is the same in all.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyang mi gtong zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyang mi gtong zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout abandoning the power of the bodhisattva‚Äôs meditative absorption‚Äù means that the dharmadhƒÅtu is the same in all.

original: sangs rgyas lta ba dang mchod pa dang rim gro yang rab tu byed de zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ston par byed do ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas lta ba dang mchod pa dang rim gro yang rab tu byed de zhes bya ba ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i gnas skabs ston par byed do ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe also performs the worship and service of seeing the buddhas‚Äù shows that he is in a state of non-meditative equipoise.

original: / rnam pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i mchod pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / rnam pa thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i mchod pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe worship that is the accomplishment of all aspects‚Äù means that he is endowed with all good qualities.

original: rgya chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan rgya chen po dang ldan pas shin tu che ba'i phyir dang / grangs rgya chen po dang ldan pa tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan rgya chen po dang ldan pas shin tu che ba'i phyir dang / grangs rgya chen po dang ldan pa tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúendowed with greatness‚Äù means that he is endowed with great good qualities, because they are very great, and because he is endowed with an immeasurable number of them.

original: byin gyi rlabs dang snang ba yang yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi snang ba yang len to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs dang snang ba yang yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi snang ba yang len to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He takes up the blessings and the light. This means that he takes up the blessings of the Buddhas and the light of the knowledge of the Buddhas.

original: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mi non pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba ni zil gyis mi non pa ste /
translated: He is unassailable, because he is invincible.

original: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rtogs pa'i mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has reached the end of the realization of the Dharma-element.

original: lam gsum yang dag par sgrogs te zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa dang lam zhes bya ba don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: lam gsum yang dag par sgrogs te zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa dang lam zhes bya ba don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: He proclaims the three paths, because the words path and progress are not different in meaning.

original: / chos kyi dbyings rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom gcod pa'i lam ste 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings shes na the tshom 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / chos kyi dbyings rab tu dbye ba shes pa zhes bya ba ni the tshom gcod pa'i lam ste 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings shes na the tshom 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: He knows the divisions of the Dharma-element, because the path of the cutting off of doubt is like this: when one knows the Dharma-element, doubt is cut off.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa myur ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa myur ba'i lam mo //
translated: He fills all world-realms, because the path of swift superknowledge is like this: when one has swift superknowledge, one fills all world-realms with one‚Äôs body.

original: zhing dang chos thams cad yongs su shes pa ni zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs so //üîΩsems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhing dang chos thams cad yongs su shes pa ni zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs so // sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The consecration of the knowledge of all the fields and all the teachings is the consecration of the sameness of the purification of the fields.

original: chos ston pa'i snang ba mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: chos ston pa'i snang ba mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The consecration of the sameness of the appearance of the teaching of the Dharma in order to ripen beings is the consecration of the sameness of the appearance of the teaching of the Dharma.üîΩIn brief, up to the consecration of the sameness of the attainment of the knowledge of all the aspects is the consecration of the sameness of manifest complete enlightenment.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the field of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the pratyekabuddha is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the pratyekabuddha.

original: mdor na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob bar byed ba'i bar dag yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni mngon bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs so //üîΩyon tan ldan pas @118b 'dra ba'i phyir //üîΩrang gi yon tan lhag pa yi //
analyzed: mdor na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob bar byed ba'i bar dag yang dag par len to zhes bya ba ni mngon bar rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i mtshungs pa nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs so // yon tan ldan pas @118b 'dra ba'i phyir // rang gi yon tan lhag pa yi //
translated: The consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the pratyekabuddha is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the pratyekabuddha.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the bodhisattva.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the pratyekabuddha is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the pratyekabuddha.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattva is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the bodhisattva.

original: mtsho dang ri dang rgya mtsho dang // nor bus sa yi dpe shes bya //
analyzed: mtsho dang ri dang rgya mtsho dang // nor bus sa yi dpe shes bya //
translated: The consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka is the consecration of the sameness of the path of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.üîΩThe consecration of the sameness of the knowledge of the path of the pratyek

original: sgrub pa'i yon tan mtsho chen po ma dros pa las byung ba'i 'bab chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyi rgya mtsho chen po zhen bar byed de zhes bya ba'i bar 'byungüîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yon tan mtsho chen po ma dros pa las byung ba'i 'bab chu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi bar gyi rgya mtsho chen po zhen bar byed de zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities of practice are like a river that flows from the great lake Anavatapta, and so on, up to the great lake of omniscient wisdom endowed with all aspects.

original: mchog nyid kyi yon tan ni /
analyzed: mchog nyid kyi yon tan ni /
translated: The quality of supremacy is as follows:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la brten nas yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu po de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la brten nas yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: O child of the victors, these ten bodhisattva stages exist in dependence on the wisdom of the buddhas, and so on, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las yang dag par bstan pa yongs su dris pa bstan pa rnams kyis thug bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las yang dag par bstan pa yongs su dris pa bstan pa rnams kyis thug bar 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: the teachings that fully reveal the activities of the buddhas are inexhaustible.

original: 'di la gangs ri dang / spos kyi ngad ldang ba dang rnam par 'dal ba ste gong ma gsum ni grangs bzhin du sems can zhes mi bya ba sman dang dri dang rin po che rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gangs ri dang / spos kyi ngad ldang ba dang rnam par 'dal ba ste gong ma gsum ni grangs bzhin du sems can zhes mi bya ba sman dang dri dang rin po che rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: The first three mountains, namely, the snowy mountains, the fragrant mountains and the mountains of uneven terrain, are not called mountains of sentient beings, but are the source of medicinal plants, perfumes and jewels.

original: bzhi pa rta rna ri drug pa'i gnas nas 'byung ba ni sems can zhes bya ba 'bras bu thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin no //üîΩlhag ma drug po drang srong gi ri dang ; gnya' shing 'dzin dang / mu khyud 'dzin dang / khor yug dang / tog can dang / ri rab rnams ni grangs bzhin du sems can zhes bya ba drang srong dang / gnod sbyin dang / klu dang dbang du gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bzhi pa rta rna ri drug pa'i gnas nas 'byung ba ni sems can zhes bya ba 'bras bu thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin no // lhag ma drug po drang srong gi ri dang ; gnya' shing 'dzin dang / mu khyud 'dzin dang / khor yug dang / tog can dang / ri rab rnams ni grangs bzhin du sems can zhes bya ba drang srong dang / gnod sbyin dang / klu dang dbang du gyur ba dang /
translated: The fourth mountain, namely, the mountain of the crescent moon, is called the mountain of sentient beings, because it is the source of all fruits.

original: lha ma yin dang / lha rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / lha rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: The remaining six mountains, namely, the mountain of the sages, the mountain of the yoke, the mountain of the girdle, the mountain of the wheel, the mountain of the banner and Mount Sumeru, are respectively the source of the sages, the yakshas, the nagas, the gandharvas, the asuras and the gods.

original: nges par 'byung dka' ba'i nges pa 'byung ba'i 'bras bu che ba'i yon tan ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung dka' ba'i nges pa 'byung ba'i 'bras bu che ba'i yon tan ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the result of the difficult deliverance?

original: ri'i rgyal po chen po bcu po ji skad du bshad pa de dag gis kyang rgya mtsho chen bo smos pa ni de lta ba'i longs spyod kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon bar 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po chen po bcu po ji skad du bshad pa de dag gis kyang rgya mtsho chen bo smos pa ni de lta ba'i longs spyod kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon bar 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The ten great kings of mountains, as explained, also praise the great ocean, because it is the cause of their enjoyment.

original: rgya mtsho chen pos kyang de dag rab tu phye ba ni de las der 'gro bar nus pa'i phyir dang / de nas 'byung ba'i rdzas rab tu ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen pos kyang de dag rab tu phye ba ni de las der 'gro bar nus pa'i phyir dang / de nas 'byung ba'i rdzas rab tu ston pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The great ocean also praises them, because it is the cause of their being opened, since one can go there from it, and it is the cause of the display of the substances that come from it.

original: yon tan gyi sgo nas rab tu gsal bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgo nas rab tu gsal bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that they are praised by their qualities.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smos pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smos pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mention of omniscience is because it is the cause of omniscience. It is said that it is praised.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis kyang rab tu phye ba ni de dag gis 'bras bu'i dngos po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rab tu gsal bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis kyang rab tu phye ba ni de dag gis 'bras bu'i dngos po yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rab tu gsal bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And it is also distinguished by omniscience, because it is the cause of the possession of the result.

original: bags kyis gzhol zhes bya ba ni 'jug bde ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: bags kyis gzhol zhes bya ba ni 'jug bde ba'i yon tan no //
translated: It is gradually sloping, which is a quality of ease of entry.

original: shi ba'i ro dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gtsang ma nyid kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: shi ba'i ro dang lhan cig mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gtsang ma nyid kyi yon tan no //
translated: It does not remain with a dead body, which is a quality of purity.

original: chu gzhan gyi grangs @119a * //
analyzed: chu gzhan gyi grangs @119a * //
translated: It is not counted among other waters,

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba med pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'dra ba med pa'i yon tan no //
translated: which is a quality of non-differentiation.

original: ro gcig pa zhes bya ba ni kun du srung ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: ro gcig pa zhes bya ba ni kun du srung ba'i yon tan no //
translated: It has one taste, which is a quality of protection.

original: rin po che mang zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: rin po che mang zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'i yon tan no //
translated: It is full of jewels, which is a quality of benefit.

original: zab cing gting dpag dka' ba zhes bya ba dang / yangs shing tshad med pa zhes bya ba gnyis kyis ni mi skam pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: zab cing gting dpag dka' ba zhes bya ba dang / yangs shing tshad med pa zhes bya ba gnyis kyis ni mi skam pa'i yon tan no //
translated: It is deep and hard to fathom, and it is vast and immeasurable, both of which are qualities of non-drying up.

original: 'byung po chen po'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: 'byung po chen po'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi yon tan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the abode of the great elements‚Äù indicates the quality of its location.

original: dus chad pa las mi yol ba dang / sprin chen po'i char thams cad kun du 'dzin pas mi ngoms pa zhes bya ba gnyis kyis ni 'jig rten srung ba'i yon tan bstan to //
analyzed: dus chad pa las mi yol ba dang / sprin chen po'i char thams cad kun du 'dzin pas mi ngoms pa zhes bya ba gnyis kyis ni 'jig rten srung ba'i yon tan bstan to //
translated: The two phrases ‚Äúit is never depleted by the passage of time‚Äù and ‚Äúit is never satisfied by its reception of the great rain clouds‚Äù indicate the quality of its protection of the world.

original: rin po che'i rigs bcu las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba la bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs bcu las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya ba la bcu gang zhe na /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is beyond the ten types of precious substances‚Äù refers to the following ten types of precious substances:üîΩpearls,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: crystal,üîΩcoral,üîΩsilver,üîΩgold,üîΩcat‚Äôs eye,üîΩmusƒÅragalva,üîΩred pearls,üîΩconch shells that spiral to the right,

original: mu tig dang / shang kha shi la dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / gser dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / mu tig dmar po dang / dung g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / rin po che dpal gyi ze ba'i snying po can rnams so //üîΩrin po che'i rigs bcu las shin tu 'das nas /
analyzed: mu tig dang / shang kha shi la dang / byi ru dang / dngul dang / gser dang / rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang / mu tig dmar po dang / dung g-yas su 'khyil ba dang / rin po che dpal gyi ze ba'i snying po can rnams so // rin po che'i rigs bcu las shin tu 'das nas /
translated: and precious substances that have the essence of the crest jewel.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i rigs kyis mngon par spags par gyur pa ni rigs kyis yongs su btags pa'i yon tan te /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che'i rigs kyis mngon par spags par gyur pa ni rigs kyis yongs su btags pa'i yon tan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is beyond the ten types of precious substances‚Äù indicates the quality of its being designated by its type.

original: 'di ltar rin po che'i rigs bcu las shin tu 'das nas mngon par sbags par gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rin po che'i rigs bcu las shin tu 'das nas mngon par sbags par gyur zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is said to be ‚Äúcompletely purified‚Äù because it has transcended the ten precious substances.

original: mgar ba mkhas pas legs par bsregs zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi yon tan no //
analyzed: mgar ba mkhas pas legs par bsregs zhes bya ba ni kha dog gi yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-heated by a skilled smith‚Äù refers to the quality of color.

original: legs par bcos zhes bya ba ni dbyibs kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: legs par bcos zhes bya ba ni dbyibs kyi yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-formed‚Äù refers to the quality of shape.

original: legs par yongs su sbyangs zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: legs par yongs su sbyangs zhes bya ba ni dri ma med pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-polished‚Äù refers to the quality of being stainless.

original: legs par byi dor byas zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: legs par byi dor byas zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-cleaned‚Äù refers to the quality of clarity.

original: legs par phug cing rin po che'i skud pas legs par btags la nor bu rin po che beed'urya'i rgyal mtshan gyi yu ba mthon po'i rtse mo la btags te zhes bya ba ni mngon bar 'du byed pa'i yon tan no //
analyzed: legs par phug cing rin po che'i skud pas legs par btags la nor bu rin po che beed'urya'i rgyal mtshan gyi yu ba mthon po'i rtse mo la btags te zhes bya ba ni mngon bar 'du byed pa'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell-pierced and well-strung on precious thread, and placed on top of the high pole of the banner of the precious jewel vai·∏ç≈´rya‚Äù refers to the quality of manifest activity.

original: thams cad du 'od zer rab tu 'byung zhes bya ba ni mthu'i yon tan no //
analyzed: thams cad du 'od zer rab tu 'byung zhes bya ba ni mthu'i yon tan no //
translated: ‚ÄúRadiating light in all directions‚Äù refers to the quality of power.

original: rgyal bos gnang ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma bzung pa'i yon tan no ;
analyzed: rgyal bos gnang ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su ma bzung pa'i yon tan no ;
translated: ‚ÄúGiven by the king‚Äù refers to the quality of being unowned.

original: skad kyi byings rnams ni nye bar bsgyur ba dang / 'brel ba'i tshig g-yos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi ji skad du bshad par 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: skad kyi byings rnams ni nye bar bsgyur ba dang / 'brel ba'i tshig g-yos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyi ji skad du bshad par 'gyur bar shes par bya ste /
translated: The verbal roots are to be understood as explained in the treatises on grammar, such as the following:üîΩThe verbal roots are applied to the meaning of the root

original: gang phyir skad bying sa don sbyor ba //üîΩ'dor bar byed pa de yi phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir skad bying sa don sbyor ba // 'dor bar byed pa de yi phyir //
translated: because they are the basis for the formation of the verbal affixes.üîΩTherefore, the verbal affixes are fully explained

original: nye bar sbyar bar rab bshad de //
analyzed: nye bar sbyar bar rab bshad de //
translated: because they are applied to the verbal roots.üîΩThe verbal prefixes are so called because they are applied to the verbal roots

original: phrad du 'jug phyir @119b tshig gi phrad //üîΩces bshad do //üîΩ'jig rten khams ni mtha' yas par //
analyzed: phrad du 'jug phyir @119b tshig gi phrad // ces bshad do // 'jig rten khams ni mtha' yas par //
translated: and because they are applied to the verbal affixes.

original: chos 'di rab tu ston pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chos 'di rab tu ston pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach this Dharma

original: sems can don sgo mtha' yas pa'i //
analyzed: sems can don sgo mtha' yas pa'i //
translated: in the limitless world systems,üîΩthe limitless doors to the meaning of the Dharma

original: chos nyid rab tu bstan pa yin //üîΩlhag pa med pa'i don gyis ni //üîΩyi ge lhag pa med dag tu //
analyzed: chos nyid rab tu bstan pa yin // lhag pa med pa'i don gyis ni // yi ge lhag pa med dag tu //
translated: are fully taught.üîΩThe meaning of the absence of remainder

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: is the absence of remainder of the letters.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩdbyig gi gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis sa bcu 'di'i //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //üîΩdbyig gi gnyen gyi zhal snga nas kyis sa bcu 'di'i //
translated: The rest is to be understood as before.üîΩVasubandhu says:

original: 'grel pa mdzad pa bdag gis rnam par phye nas 'dir //
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pa bdag gis rnam par phye nas 'dir //
translated: I, the author of the commentary, have analyzed it here.üîΩBy whatever virtue has come from this,

original: dge bar gyur ba gang des 'gro ba 'di yi blo //
analyzed: dge bar gyur ba gang des 'gro ba 'di yi blo //
translated: may the minds of beings shineüîΩlike the glory of the lotus by the sun's rays.

original: nyi zer rnams kyis padmo'i dpal bzhin snang bar shog / dge bsrungs kyis ni bcos bas na //
analyzed: nyi zer rnams kyis padmo'i dpal bzhin snang bar shog / dge bsrungs kyis ni bcos bas na //
translated: By the composition of the protector of virtue,

original: rnam par bshad pa gya tsam byas //üîΩdon du gnyer na mkhas pa rnams //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa gya tsam byas // don du gnyer na mkhas pa rnams //
translated: this commentary has been made.üîΩIf one strives for the meaning,

original: gnas min par yang gom pa 'dor //
analyzed: gnas min par yang gom pa 'dor //
translated: the wise will step even where they should not.

original: 'phags pas bcu'i rnam par bshad pa'i rnam par bshad pa slob dpon nyi ma grub kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pas bcu'i rnam par bshad pa'i rnam par bshad pa slob dpon nyi ma grub kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the commentary on the ten topics of the noble ones, composed by the master S≈´ryadatta, is completed.
